column2: EagleView, the leader in aerial imagery, is hiring a Senior Product Man ager-Construction. In this role you will be responsible for product strategies in regards to our customers business practices and needs, Manage entire product life cycle including new products, enhancements and end-of-life, and drive product launches by working with product marketing, marketing, sales and customer success on messaging, presentations, videos, white papers and other deliverables.     The successful candidate will be passionate about defining EagleView s mission of transforming the way our customers work, by delivering property data with actionable insights in an ever-changing world and be ready to challenge the status-quo while driving innovative ideas.       Primary Responsibilities:       Product Strategy        Propose new solutions based on customer input, surveys, imaginative interpretation of user needs, market needs analysis, and known technological solutions.         Create product strategies to address market needs and translate into a product roadmap.         Monitor competitors activities to determine possible future directions.         Develop value-based pricing and compelling business models for your products.         Contribute to annual and quarterly product roadmaps.         Define Lean Business Cases for new products       Product Management        Define, drive, and maintain the product roadmap and backlog.         Create and/or maintain appropriate product documentation in JIRA.         Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact.         Manage product releases through the development lifecycle.         Work with development, project management, operations, and other departments to prepare release objectives, milestones and schedules for all phases of product development and launch.         Design and execute pilots to validate hypotheses about potential products and features.         Measure success of new initiatives and make data-driven decisions to continually improve and/or course correct.         Identify opportunities to improve customer experience and incorporate enhancements on an ongoing basis.         Prioritize roadmap, features, and initiatives in an agile work environment.       Go to Market        Keep in close contact with customers and prospective customers on the leading edge of the industry, including site visits.         Participate in key sales situations and maintain a close relationship with sales teams.         Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding.         Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services.       Leadership        Communicate with confidence and demonstrate mastery of your product when interacting with executives, peers, director reports, customers, and partners.         Take action and drive issues to resolution.         Actively engage customers and key stakeholders to drive business requirement definition and keep all stakeholders informed of progress; ensure that executive sponsors and others are aware of any potential roadblocks or inability to deliver as committed.         Complete projects and tasks on time, on target, and on budget.         Exhibit responsiveness and willingness to go the extra mile to achieve important goals.         Report regularly on performance against key business metrics     Skills/Requirements      Bachelor s degree, MBA or equivalent experience.         Proven ability to understand market and customer needs; define new products and business models; and build and sell products.         Experience in leading projects and working with cross disciplinary teams.         Strong technical aptitude, including knowledge of the software development processes, data-driven products, system integration and APIs.         Experience with construction / solar technologies or the construction / solar industry is a plus!         Certification or experience in Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).         Experience with UX/UI and user centered design.         Ability to travel.       Personal Qualities        Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with the ability to persuade and excite executives, colleagues and customers on merits of our products and strategies.         Honest, candid and trustworthy. A team player.         Executes fast and gets things done.         Takes ownership and initiative. Has a plan and moves quickly to execute.         Ambitious and driven to win. Desire and capability to become a senior leader at EagleView.         Agile and adaptable. Thrives on change.         Quick study. Gains proficiency in new industries, markets and technologies quickly.

column2: What You ll Do:      You will work alongside our Partners Team and peers within our Global Customer Services org to ensure the holistic success of LS s strategic partnerships.         You will bring strong relationship-building experience, product knowledge, project management, organizational and problem-solving skills, as well as a high degree of empathy to maintain a best-in-class partner and customer experience.         Maintain a deep understanding of LS Partners businesses and be an internal champion of the features/functionality most critical to their specific business needs.         You ll be expected to meet and exceed the goal for net retention (both retention and expansion) which is driven through consistent communication and collaboration with our Partners teams and demonstrating the value the products and services provide to their business via quarterly reviews. Although the role will sit on the Customer Success Team in order to maintain familiarity with best practices and processes to continue to ensure the success of our joint customers, this is a truly cross-functional position. Proven ability to develop working relationships at all levels of management, both inside your company and within your customer accounts         Experience with project management, account portfolio planning and prioritizing         Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure         Excellent written and spoken communication skills         Possess top-notch organizational and analytical skills, especially with Sales force/Gain Sight knowledge         Track record of successful planning and execution of Executive Business Reviews         Understanding of Shopify ecosystems industry a plus

column2: JOB PURPOSE        The Product Manager will be responsible for the product vision, planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle. Gathering and prioritising market / customer requirements and working closely with product, sales & marketing teams to ensure growth, revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met.            PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES        The accountabilities include:        Understanding and managing customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share and drive growth      Analysing consumer needs, market trends, and potential partnerships      Product and business-planning process across cross-functional teams of the organisation          Analysing product requirements and develop appropriate programs to achieve success          Creating clear technical specifications from business requirements, developing project scopes, objectives and milestones, involving all relevant stakeholders (internal and external) and ensure technical feasibility      Working with the team to define the product road map and ensure that this is effectively communicated to partners/suppliers.      Managing partner and supplier relationships and working with them to ensure that the product phases are delivered on time and user-centric.      Ensuring the features of the product meet the customers needs and prioritising a positive user experience / business benefit.      Working closely with research colleagues and agencies to help gather and evaluate data to ensure a continuous and rigorous evaluation for the products at all stages of development, including live products.      Tracking and communicating project statuses and identify, address and escalate potential setbacks and risks      Ensuring iterative, user-centred, and agile approaches are employed as appropriate, leading to products that are tightly focused on customer needs and value.            Working with the team to set up and manage new processes, including management of partners and suppliers, ensuring that processes are carried out efficiently and deliverables produced to the highest levels of quality and accuracy at all of the stages, following standard procedures and to pre-established schedules.      To maintain a culture of systematic process review looking to standardise and homogenise processes as much as possible therefore maximising process efficiency, cost effectiveness and flexibility of resources. Strong analytical and problem solving skills      Proven ability to multi-task, be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment, in a high pressured environment with changing priorities      High attention to detail and quality of work                  Experience        Essential        5 + years of product management experience      Knowledgeable about emerging digital / EdTech trends      Considerable experience of working under pressure to demanding deadlines      Extensive experience of managing outsourced/partner driven creative work      Understanding of best practice principles for digital development across multiple devices and platforms      A proven track-record in the development and delivery of digital learning products              Desirable          Experience of working on a Learning Management System including managing content development      Substantial knowledge/experience of working in education in a global and digital education context      Experience of setting up new functions for an international company would be advantageous.      Experience in different SDLC methodologies including Agile      Extensive experience of managing complex projects in a large and complex organisation      Experience working in a technological role with proven experience in delivering end to end IT projects                  Behaviours          A professional manner and high levels of personal diplomacy      A positive attitude and willingness to work with ambiguity. Capable of building strong relationships and developing successful partnerships      Display a great determination to get things done effectively and to deadlines. column2: Role :    Payments Product Manager - India (Fintech Farm) About Fintech Farm We are a UK fintech creating successful neobanks in emerging markets in partnerships with local traditional banks. Our success builds upon a best-in-class product, customer experience, emotional engagement, viral marketing, and deep credit decision-making expertise. One of our founders had previously co-founded a highly successful Eastern European neobank with a multi-million customer base. We launched our first market with Leobank in Azerbaijan in 2021, where we have already established market-leading positions. Our next market was Vietnam, where we launched Liobank in early 2023 and gained solid traction. India is our next market, and we are looking to launch in the next six months. We are currently building a core team there. Why Fintech Farm is a great place to be Our ambition  -We are looking to become a leading consumer digital bank brand in each market we operate making it easy for consumers to interact with their money. You could be a part of this exciting journey. Customers -  We always go above and beyond to provide an amazing customer experience. We serve our customers the way we would want our mom to be served. And who said that banking has to be boring? We make our apps not just easy but fun to use. People -  We are all business partners in our company. Each of us thinks big, acts as if we own the place, and never takes No as an answer. We work with strong individuals whom we empower and trust rather than micromanage. Common sense rather than formal policies prevails in all that we do. We always stay curious and open-minded. We embrace the We over Me culture. Your Role: As an accomplished Payments Product Manager in the banking sector, you will leverage your extensive experience to drive innovative product strategies and solutions for building the new digital bank in India. What You Will Be Doing:  Conduct in-depth analysis of banking products, like QR-payments, p2p and p2m transfers, mobile and utilities payments, account funding, and savings accounts, considering customer needs and market dynamics  Develop, refine and implement product strategies, policies, and procedures, ensuring alignment with evolving market trends and regulatory requirements  Develop relationships, negotiate commercials and ensure seamless integrations with third-party providers (payment systems, fintech etc)  Discuss, order and receive technical documentation (APIs, specifications, etc.) from the partner bank and third-party providers to hand over to the developers' team  Create cash flow and accounting schemes for payment features, build reconciliation and settlement systems with the partner bank and third-party providers  Work with cross-functional teams, including technology, marketing and finance, to ensure seamless execution and successful product launches  Prepare management and regulatory reports to provide comprehensive insights into product performance  Employ data-driven insights to optimise product performance, make informed recommendations on product features, pricing and terms to enhance customer satisfaction and adjust product strategies in line with market and regulatory developments Your Experience:  5-7+ years of progressive experience in Product/Project management within the Banking industry and Fintech, demonstrating a track record of successful product launches  Solid experience in launching projects on UPI payments as well as mobile, utility, and other payments  Preferably, experience in a startup or fast-paced environment, showcasing adaptability and agility in product management  In-depth knowledge of local and international regulations in banking and financial services What we are offering Collaborative work culture & competitive salary as per industry standards You will report to our project director in India and work closely with our partner bank and Payments Business Lead at Fintech Farm. Our partner bank is based in Mumbai, and our central payments and development teams are based in Europe, and you will be a vital bridge between these worlds. If interested, please send your CV and a cover note outlining your motivation and suitability for the role.

column2: Product Manager - Dashboard - J47753 Overview: As a Product Manager specializing in dashboard experiences, you will be responsible for driving the strategy, development, and optimization of dashboards for brand, merchants, and internal operations within our organization. Your role will involve working closely with cross-functional teams to understand user needs, prioritize features, and deliver impactful solutions that enhance user experience and drive business outcomes.     Key Responsibilities: Strategy and Roadmap: Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for dashboard experiences catering to brand, merchants, and internal operations. Identify key user pain points and opportunities for improvement through data analysis, user feedback, and market research. Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders, including brand managers, merchants, and operations teams, to gather and prioritize requirements for dashboard features and functionalities. Translate business needs into clear and actionable product requirements and user stories. Design and Development: Work closely with UX/UI designers to create intuitive and visually appealing dashboard designs that meet user needs and align with brand guidelines. Partner with engineering teams to ensure timely and high-quality development of dashboard features, following best practices and industry standards. User Experience Optimization: Conduct usability testing, gather user feedback, and analyze data to iteratively improve dashboard usability, performance, and engagement. Implement data-driven optimizations and A/B testing strategies to enhance user experience and drive user adoption. Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product marketing, sales, and customer support, to ensure alignment of dashboard features with overall product strategy and business objectives. Work closely with data analytics and business intelligence teams to integrate relevant data sources and metrics into dashboards for actionable insights. Documentation and Training: Create and maintain documentation, user guides, and training materials to support users in effectively utilising dashboard features and functionalities. Conduct training sessions and workshops for internal teams and external stakeholders on how to leverage dashboards for data-driven decision-making.     Qualifications: Bachelor`s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field. 2+ years of experience as a Product Manager, with a focus on dashboard development and analytics tools. Strong understanding of data visualisation principles, dashboard design best practices, and user experience optimization. Proficiency in project management methodologies, Agile development processes, and product management tools (e.g., Jira, Asana). Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present ideas to stakeholders. Experience in the fintech or e-commerce industry is preferred, with knowledge of brand management, merchant operations, and internal analytics workflows. column2: As a Product Manager at Tractor Junction, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the success of our products. You will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation through development to launch and post-launch optimization. Your efforts will have a direct impact on our customers' satisfaction and the efficiency of our internal processes. Key Responsibilities : - Product Strategy : Develop and communicate a clear and compelling product strategy that aligns with the company's overall goals and objectives. - Product Roadmap : Create and maintain product roadmaps that outline key milestones and feature releases for each product. - Stakeholder Collaboration : Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and sales, to ensure successful product development and launch. - Customer Insights : Conduct market research and gather customer feedback to identify opportunities and pain points, ensuring that our products meet customer needs and expectations. - Prioritization : Make informed decisions on feature prioritization based on business impact, user feedback, and technical feasibility. - Product Development : Lead the product development process, collaborating with engineers and designers to deliver high-quality products on time and within budget. - Testing and Validation : Oversee user testing, gather feedback, and iterate on product features to optimize user experience. - Performance Monitoring : Continuously monitor and analyze product performance using relevant metrics and KPIs, taking proactive measures to improve them. - Documentation : Create and maintain comprehensive product documentation, including feature specifications, user guides, and release notes. - Communication : Effectively communicate product updates, changes, and timelines to internal stakeholders and customers. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (business, engineering, or similar); MBA is a plus. - Proven experience as a Product Manager, preferably working on both customer-facing and internal products. - Strong analytical skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions. - Excellent project management and organizational skills. - Exceptional communication and collaboration abilities. - Demonstrated ability to manage multiple products simultaneously. - Knowledge of Agile methodologies - Hands on experience with GA4, UA, GTM, Jira, Figma

Deep understanding of IT architecture, infrastructure, and cloud development principles including Azure Bus, Azure Data Factory, Ingress Nginx for Kubernetes. Performance Optimization and Scalability:  Lead efforts to optimize System performance for speed and scalability. Documentation Excellence:  Oversee the creation of clear and comprehensive API documentation for developers. Identify and address issues promptly to maintain a high level of service availability.  Working experience of monitoring tools like Azure Monitor/Cloud Watch/Dotcom Monitor etc. 7. Security and Authentication Expertise:  Oversee the implementation of robust security measures, including advanced authentication, authorization, encryption mechanisms & storage solutions.  Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of data exchanged through various tools & libraries required in the application.  Well versed in security design and principles to ensure zero vulnerability, 100% secure system design. 8. Project Management and Execution: Oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of complex technical projects within defined timelines and budgets. Team Management and Development: Recruit, train, and manage a high-performing team of technical professionals. Promote knowledge sharing and cross-functional collaboration among team members. 10. Technical Expertise and Compliance: Provide expert guidance on technical matters, ensuring compliance with industry regulations and standards. Stay updated on regulatory requirements, industry guidelines, and quality standards relevant to pharmaceutical operations. Build and maintain relationships with external partners, vendors, and regulatory bodies as required. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Our Automation CoE serves as a centralized hub for all process automation-related developments using Low code/ No code platforms, providing guidance, governance, and support to ensure successful automation initiatives. Customers from various workstreams are looking for optimising and automate their existing business process.   As the Technical Platform Owner, you will work with multi-functional teams to drive the strategic development of various process automation platforms.          Key responsibilities:         Product Strategy and Roadmap:    Develop and maintain a clear product strategy and roadmap for process automation solutions, aligning with different business goals and demands.   Close collaboration with Business Cross-functional teams: Engage with business regularly to gather feedback, understand pain points, and identify opportunities for improvement, ensuring a customer-centric approach to product development. Foster Collaboration with business owners from different Workstreams to identify and prioritize areas, workflows and processes suitable for automation. Develop product vision and roadmap plan aligned with business strategy and communicates across all critical stakeholders. Understand and communicates the need to show a return on investment and prepares an operating budget for the product. Support in preparing business cases for investment.       ?           Process Analysis:    Support business in process analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and potential gaps in the process automation landscape. Lead assessment of business processes through process demos , mapping, analysis, validating and signing off business benefits from leadership. Supporting process discovery workshops involving Technology and Operations teams to carry out deep dives of the process flows. Product Development:    Work closely with engineering and design teams to translate requirements into product features, overseeing the product development lifecycle from ideation to launch and beyond.             Product Launch:    Lead product launch activities, including developing strategies, and coordinating with business teams to ensure successful process adoption.   Product Performance Monitoring: Define key performance metrics and monitor product performance post-launch, gathering feedback and data to iterate on product features and enhancements.             Product Delivery Development Lifecycle :       Drive key end-to-end lifecycle components solution design, development, testing and deployment. Has a thorough understanding of the broader product experience and uses this knowledge to develop comprehensive prototypes. Works closely with Sr. BA to write clear requirements for complex features or products and is responsive to requests for clarifications.   Tracking progress of annual priorities and goals against automation program KPIs. Set up and report the utilisation of different platform licenses. Help drive solutions for complicated design challenges.             ?       Qualification       Proven experience 6-8 in product management, preferably with a focus on process automation solutions.   Demonstrated ability to develop and execute product strategies, including process analysis, roadmap development, and product planning.   Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.   Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and drive them to successful completion.   Analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data and metrics to drive decision-making and product improvements.   Customer-focused with a passion for understanding customer needs and delivering solutions that exceed their expectations.   Advantage: Strong understanding of process automation technologies, including robotic process automation (RPA), workflow automation, and business process management (BPM).           Technical Skills     Understands company technology stack at a high level, for the broader product. Speaks knowledgably with tech and data counterparts about development approaches in consideration.   Learns about new technologies to support new product development efforts.   Is comfortable analysing data using existing software packages (e.g. Excel).

column2: The    Sr Product Manager    will be responsible for overseeing a key strategic area of MINDBODY s core software products. This role is responsible for overseeing and running scrum teams in charge of large strategic projects.      The Sr Product Manager will be responsible for creating and maintaining a backlog of work for each product owner, creating business plans based on market research and data analysis, and pitching these product ideas to senior management. The Sr Product Manager will be required to work cross functionally between the UX Design and Research, Product Managers and Engineering teams to support the product vision and achieve strategic business objectives.               QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:         Bachelor s Degree in a technology or technical related field     MBA or other graduate-level degree (preferred)       10+ years of overall experience preferably in a product / SaaS company         7+ years as a B2B Product Owner/Manager in a top-tier technology/SaaS company         Proven track record of successfully managing and releasing complex SaaS products       Certifications such as Scrum Master or PMP (preferred)     Intimate knowledge of key Product Management Principles, Agile Scrum and UX Centered Design principles     Entrepreneurial spirit / ability to roll up your sleeves and try different things with minimal direction     Possesses a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, the drive to make that vision a reality, and technically credible to lead teams of world-class software developers     Is organized, and can plan, forecast, and manage a product backlog     Exceptional organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills     Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate and work with stakeholders at all levels across the organization     Experience handling enterprise-level clients/customers (preferred)     Track record driving and delivering large, complicated projects on time and within scope (preferred)     Subject matter expertise in many different technology markets (preferred)             PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:         Works with engineering to drive product development from conceptualization through launch - creating actionable plans, work streams, tactics and deliver on those in support of business KPI s     Product owner for one or more product development teams     Formulates complex business plans, analyzes the current competitive landscape, focuses on ROI and puts together a strategic product roadmap and pitch to the senior leaders in the company     Manages the product roadmap for your strategic area, setting expectations with all relevant stakeholders     Can operate under limited supervision is products to market     Leverages data/analytics to make tactical and strategic product decisions     Demonstrate favorable results through leadership and influencing multiple individuals and groups     Cultivates a deep understanding of the customer and work tirelessly to identify new opportunities to improve their experience     Identifies unmet market needs that leverage MINDBODY technologies, strengths and market leadership     Produces and manages usability studies, product metrics, competitive, customer and market analysis into product requirements to identify new opportunities     Strives to be a subject matter expert in their strategic focus area(s) by identifying the challenges our customers face and defines new opportunities to improve our customers experience     Builds column2: Apply your knowledge of market, product, competition, and most importantly those earned secrets with early customers to define, build and iterate on product functionality. Knowledge of business objectives and be creative enough to help define what we build, with demonstrated experience leading developer facing product efforts.      Communication skills to manage the large degree of external interaction with customers and partners the role needs.      Ability in delivering quickly and collaboratively.      Ability to take ownership and is accountable for quality of all deliverables.      Ability to lead/supervise multiple projects, also performs project management activities such as planning, sizing, configuration, resources and scheduling.      Ability to conceptualize and develop resolutions to complex market challenges and customer use cases that require the use of creativity. Leveraging these processes, you are responsible to ensure that each item on the road map deemed at risk of delivery has an appropriate path to green plan, fully produced and signed off by the relevant product and engineering managers working on that specific item. column2: Product Analyst             As a Product Analyst, you will be responsible for performing software product requirements analysis and specification for the product engineering group that you are assigned to. A successful candidate will have deep business domain knowledge in the healthcare industry, particularly in health insurance payer processes and systems. You will demonstrate an established track record of analyzing, specifying, and managing software product requirements in a software product development organization. You will also possess excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.     Key Responsibilities                     Closely work with the Product Management team to understand the product vision, strategic product direction, and product roadmap   Meet with customers and internal stakeholders to understand the business objectives and rationale behind specific customer requests   Clearly document the business value associated with enhancements to help drive prioritization within the backlog   Specify and document software requirements in story format (as in agile methodology) with proper acceptance criteria that meet the business requirements   Resolve questions and provide clarifications raised by the engineering team during the development process   Review test plans to ensure that developed solutions will meet defined requirements   Assist Product Managers with the acceptance and demonstration of new product features   Work with the Product Managers to maintain the product backlog to ensure a sufficient level of backlog items for the engineering team         Requirements             Proven track record of successfully working within product management or other business functions to analyze, define, and document software requirements for commercial software product development   Proven business acumen and in-depth business domain knowledge in healthcare industry   in general, and in health insurance in particular   Excellent analytical skills   More than 5 years of experience in business or system analysis in support of software product or application development. Understanding of best practices in software requirements   Have experience and be comfortable working with high performing engineering teams   Have solid understanding of software engineering concepts and software development life cycle   Have strong ability to effectively communicate business requirements to the engineers   Experience working in an agile/scrum software development environment   Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present and articulate complex business and software requirements in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences         Product Analyst             Excellent organization and project management skills and attention to details   Bachelor?s Degree (MBA preferred)

column1: Product Manager, Oracle Cloud Financials - Core Accounting
column2: Join our Core Accounting Product Management team within Oracle Cloud ERP and embark on a journey to shape the next generation of finance functions, focused around the Record to Report process. This opportunity will place you at the heart of our mission to redefine and enhance the way businesses manage their financials, from transaction capture through to the period-end close. In this role, you will contribute to optimizing accounting practices, simplifying the period-end close, driving innovation in financial reporting and compliance, and improving the overall financial health of our customers' businesses. By collaborating closely with application developers, quality assurance teams, release management, and support teams throughout the product lifecycle, you will ensure the delivery of high-quality, innovative solutions that make financial reporting seamless and more efficient.   Responsibilities for the role include: Lead a discussion with the management to gain insight into the product roadmap and project assigned - its background, goal and scope. Ensure management expectations & delivery timelines are clearly understood. Liaison between Strategy/Customer/Management to understand customer business processes and get a complete 360 analysis of the related requirements. Formulate how the product roadmap will help acquire new customers/market penetration by recording value proposition. Be creative in designing solutions for customer problems/requirements.? Produce high quality design document with comprehensive and detailed solution analysis with a focus on all core areas: extensibility, robustness, backward compatibility, supportability, exception handling, performance expectations/bench-marking, upgrade plan for customers, critical technology or product dependencies, product resiliency (self-correction) and flexibility (user self-service feature), cloud operational considerations: recover and restart ability, opt-in options for the customer. Design should include the definition of product use cases, wireframes and upstream and downstream impact areas Uphold product quality to the highest standards.? As part of design it is very critical to document testing strategy that identifies the success/acceptance criteria for the project. Ensure that any test-ware is in line with focus of the enhancement, is tested with real customer use cases/data patterns and influences. Ensure the MVP definition is aligned with customer commitment in mind, and management sign off is received. Collaborate with Developers on reviewing any technical solution document to ensure that it is aligned with the finalized solution approach Work closely with Technical Writers to create launch deliverables like New Feature Summary, Whats New and TOI's You will be a financial functional expert capable of establishing relationships with many highly technical teams. You will be able to understand current and future technology and to identify opportunities for its use to benefit customers through discussions with developers. Requirements: Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree (or Post Graduate/Doctorate) in Finance and Accounting or Economics or Computer Science. Professional Certifications such as CA/CMA/CPA would be added advantage Financial educational background is very much desirable.?The successful applicant should have in-depth understanding of financial flows and business processes involved in finance management. Experience in SaaS Enterprise Resource Planning product management, consulting, or finance operations. Other qualifications: Experience in SaaS Enterprise Performance Management. Strong analytical skills, strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to thrive in fast paced environment and learn quickly. Desire to work in a cross-functional, co-located team environment. Demonstrate an excellent understanding of standard word processing, spreadsheet and presentation applications. Experience of working in an Agile environment with a strong understanding of the Scrum framework and principles. Ability to train/coach/adopt teams to adopt continuous delivery practices and lean/agile methodologies. Experience in developing cloud products with strong understanding of Cloud native application patterns, CI/CD, DevOps. Experience in using Data analysis to derive product and business insights for driving product design and strategy. Experience in designing modern customer experience with exposure to Information architecture, Interaction design, user persona identification and modelling etc. Experience in digital customer experience, digital product management.

column2: As the Digital Product Senior Manager for Experimentation Execution and Enablement, you will be joining a center of excellence team that is responsible for driving internal client value through cross channel experimentation practices and principles across various American Express verticals.              You will act as an internal "sherpa" or consultant and be the first point of contact for over 50+ product teams across the entire enterprise to effectively launch experiments.              You will play a key role in creating a best in class digital experimentation program for Amex by consulting with product, engineering and analytics stakeholders on how to properly use the tooling and technology available to ideate, set up experimentation parameters, and build and launch experiments following standardized, centralized approaches and best practices.                      Additionally, you will work very closely with Experimentation Product and Engineering teams and analytics counterparts to provide product requirements for tooling, capture stakeholder use cases, pain points success stories, help prioritize and escalate needs for issue resolution, and create scalable workflows, documents, templates and processes that will be accessed and used by a variety of stakeholders for an improved experimentation execution experience.              Your goals will be to drive a faster speed to market of a/b tests and progress the organization to a higher velocity of experiments and experiment-informed feature deliveries.                  The ideal candidate for this role will be highly technical and analytical to understand the complex architectures, metrics and implementations across different customer journeys and touchpoints within the Amex website and mobile app.              The candidate must also be a virtuoso of building strong cross-functional relationships, has a strong aptitude for going deep into details with teams, but also easily summarize and level up the details to digestible action items.              Lastly, the candidate must have experience successfully leading through influence across a broad set of stakeholders of varied expertise levels, all while maintaining a sense of calm in fast-paced, high demand environment.         This role reports to Director, Digital Product Management, Experimentation.                     Key Responsibilities:                     Create and lead experimentation enablement strategy; Set the goals and standards for high impact experimentation for Amex product teams                 Responsible for day to day support and execution with a diverse range of product teams to effectively launch experiments at a higher velocity and with reduced time to market                  Set success metrics and build structure for accurate reporting and identify opportunities for improved and up to par practices and methodology                 Onboard and provide ongoing experimentation platform training to product, engineering and analytics teams                 Manage and lead career development for 1 direct report                  Create and present vision, planning, recommendations and insights to internal execution teams and upwards to executive leadership, using compelling and relevant storytelling, backed by robust analysis                 Act as conduit between internal Amex user teams and Experimentation Product team to reflect needs for experimentation platform and solutions                 Develop, document and evangelize new and scalable processes, automated workflows and instructions to enable proper experimentation                 Create a robust services engagement model to support a 1 to many structure                 Create and facilitate learning forums and roadshows to increase awareness, knowledge and proficiency of Experimentation                 Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including creative, design and technology to shape meaningful customer journeys and customer centric thinking through use of Experimentation                     Required Skills / Qualifications:                     Minimum of 5+ years working hands-on building experimentation programs across a diverse range of functions, with at least 2+ years working across portfolio/product development and engineering teams, or in large, highly matrixed organizations, and/or 2 years working in management consulting                 Master level proficiency with experimentation tools, preferably Optimizely or similar, and in-house platforms                 Master level proficiency of product development principles, process and ecosystem                 High technical acumen, with experience of building features and experiments on a variety of website frameworks such as React and Angular.                 Analytics experience, preferably using Adobe Analytics                 Excellent collaborator with ability to foster co-creation across a broad set of partners to ideate, solution, prioritize, and deliver a diverse set of resources and tools accommodating various internal personas                 Strong presentation and communication skills with the ability to visualize detailed information and translate complicated insights into a clear story and recommendations for senior audiences                 Experience with enterprise collaboration platforms including Jira, Rally, Confluence and Airtable                 Must be highly independent, with demonstrated ability to self-start, carve opportunities out of white space, solve problems without significant oversight                 Skilled in Agile product development methodologies, program and project management, with proven ability to define and deliver a strategic roadmap                 A curious mind with a keen attention to detail                 History of high performance with proven ability to excel in a fast-paced environment, adjust to shifting priorities, and adapt to change                                         Benefits include:           Competitive base salaries          Bonus incentives          Support for financial-well-being and retirement          Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits (depending on location)          Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need          Generous paid parental leave policies (depending on your location)          Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)          Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program          Career development and training opportunities

column2: Meet Our Team: The number of our Pega Cloud as-a-service customers is rapidly growing. We are looking for a Product Manager who will help us drive this growth by building highly scalable cutting-edge cloud-based microservices. If you feel like you want to be a part of this challenge, please let us know! Pega Cloud provides the environments, operations, security, and scalability to operate and support Pega solutions. Our service delivers the best Pega has to offer in an available, reliable, and secure modern cloud architecture. Picture Yourself At Pega: Pega is changing the way the world builds software. In this role, youll help us define and deliver the next generation of Pega Cloud services. As a Product Manager, you will drive, prioritize, and communicate the work that our engineering teams need to deliver based on business needs. What You'll Do At Pega: Collaborate directly with the development teams to clearly communicate business needs and convert these into detailed plans for implementation. Collaborate with cross-functional teams with other parts of the business (engineering, architecture, business, operations, project management) to build a strong support ecosystem around your product. Conduct market research to identify customer needs, analyze competitor offerings, present recommendations to senior leadership and Cloud Product Management Team. Oversee and administer key aspects of Pegas Product Development Lifecycle, including requirements preparation and review, conducting Agile ceremonies, reviewing and contributing to product documentation & release notes. Define the product roadmap and prioritize features and functionalities based on stakeholders needs and business impact. Define and monitor key product metrics and gather user feedback to analyze product adoption and identify areas for improvement. Provide ongoing support and gather user feedback on the product. Mentorship of other Product Owners and Development teams  Who You Are: A true leader who is technically capable to understand our Pega Cloud product and who can drive it to success An effective communicator and collaborator An individual who demonstrates initiative and autonomy at work Someone looking to work within a culture that values urgency and teamwork & enjoys a cross-functional environment An individual with a blend of technological know-how and strategic vision A thought leader who expresses facts, thoughts, and ideas in a clear, concise, convincing, and organized manner Someone who has an eye towards design, and drive to find simple solutions to complex problems Someone who enjoys making decisions under time pressure Someone who is empathetic and passionate about ones products and customers/end-users Someone who is proactive in identifying and addressing constraints that challenge the completion of the assigned task Someone who practices continuous improvement  What You've Accomplished: Minimum of 3 years of technical leadership or product/project management experience Demonstrated success in defining, launching, and managing services Experience in cloud technologies: Kubernetes, AWS, GCP, Azure, Kafka, Networking, etc. Experience in Agile methodologies Knowledge of Agile development methodologies such as SCRUM (as a Product Owner) Experience in managing remote senior stakeholders Ability to effectively describe and demonstrate product functionality to internal and external stakeholders & clients

column2: About the Team: Be part of a best-in-class Global People Analytics team Recently awarded three gold and silver awards in the 2022 Brandon Hall Group HCM Excellence Awards, the Global People Analytics (GPA) team stives to provide Accenture business and HR leaders with strategic and operational analytics and insights to enable data-led decision making. You will progress through the variety of vibrant and challenging career paths within our team, each with a different set of skills and area of focus. About this role: The Product & Offering group are the bridge between our business-facing advisory groups, and the technical solutions, architecture and development groups. Product & Offering roles oversee a portfolio of products, services, and offerings for an assigned area, and are responsible for new product and offering development, planning and implementing a product roadmap, and overseeing the execution of the product development lifecycle activities. Responsibilities: Develop collaborative working relationships with teams across the ecosystem to achieve or objectives Assist in developing and maintaining a product vision, roadmap, and strategy for the assigned area/portfolio Build and maintain expertise in our products landscape, applying this knowledge to help solve problems and address opportunities Champion activation and enablement of products and participate in change management/learning activities Participate in program planning, and execution of our plans using Agile/SaFE methodology Assist with design of solutions and products that are fit-for-purpose, aligned with standards and principles, and are user-centric, while being technically feasible Effectively plan and prioritize work to achieve or objectives in a cost-effective manner. Communicate actively with stakeholders to understand the implications of re-prioritization Assist with triage and help resolve issues with products, working with development teams to execute fixes/enhancements Participate in quality and testing activities for the assigned product area/portfolio Gather user/customer feedback on products, services, and offerings, applying feedback as needed with a focus on continual improvement Identify and champion self-enablement and participate in learning/change activities aimed to bring awareness and promote data fluency and tool/solution adoption Understand and apply new and different methologoies to optimize our product strategy and management approach. Continually research and learn about best practices that we can apply. If required, supervise the work of junior team members assigned to the same business area and help also to support the product owner manager during absences Qualification Professional Qualifications Minimum 5 years of Human Resources experience Reporting & Analytics skills are highly relevant capability to interact with scrum masters Ability to work in multi-task projects Desirable experience includes: HR Reporting & Analytics Product Lifecycle Management Agile methodologies, capability to prioritize backlogs and tasks, Experience with Workday/SAP/Oracle application capabilities (e.g.:HRIS experience) Desirable Power BI

column2: Job Overview: Mitratech is seeking a  Senior Product Manager  to work with on our flagship Legal technology application, TeamConnect. You will leverage your cross-functional (Marketing, Support, Services, Sales) skills to lead teams and ensure we build the right offerings to drive customer retention and win new logos.  Even better, you will be challenged and you will grow at Mitratech. You will be asked to draw upon Agile and project management skills to increase the effectiveness of engineering execution and drive scale. Working with our team requires a unique blend of business acumen and technical skills demonstrated through your comfort to switch between exchanging detailed communications with engineering, summarizing business value to executives, and being responsive to clients/prospects.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Develop & execute an integrated product strategy  Define milestones (with details that others can follow) to achieve a roadmap Partner with peer product managers to execute a roadmap Drive conversations with multiple stakeholders toward logical agreement around product direction, messaging, positioning, and go-to-market strategies Develop strategies for clients where there is a mix of deployment approaches (on-premise, hosted, SaaS) Present / demo/influence customers, prospects, peers, and leadership in the product roadmap decisions Develop product/project metrics and a means to measure success from a financial & end-user traction/engagement POV Partner with Technical Project Managers and UI/UX leads to lead development teams on the execution of priorities Ability to work two days a week until 11:00 PM IST Requirements & Skills: At least 6 - 8 years of product management experience (B2B preferred) Track record of successfully developing & launching products (not just projects) within the Fortune 1000 Understand how to drive team (engineering, cross-functional) success in a remote-first & internationally diverse (global time-zones) environment Understand the economics of product(s) Strong project management skills;  document, socialize & archive product artifacts Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including high proficiency or fluency in English, both written and verbal Ability to communicate across functional teams with different languages??(Engineering, Sales, Services, etc) Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills with an emphasis on user-centered discovery and production definition experience Knowledge of corporate legal software/workflows in matter management and e-billing or prior experience with ERP financial software (not mandatory) Exposure to integrating acquired product lines into a business and developing strategies for them to align (not mandatory) Familiar with common development and collaboration tools such as JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, and Aha! (not mandatory) Experience with platform product management, prioritization, and organizational alignment of multiple teams working together (not mandatory) We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

column2: As a Product Manager for a digital news media platform, you are responsible for shaping the vision and strategy of digital products, ensuring they align with the organization's goals and meet the needs of the audience. You will oversee the entire product development lifecycle, from concept to delivery, working closely with cross-functional teams. Key Responsibilities: 1. Product Strategy and Vision: - Define and communicate the product's long-term vision and strategy. - Understand market trends, audience needs, and competitive landscape to inform product decisions. - Align the product roadmap with the company's mission and objectives. 2. Requirements Gathering: - Collaborate with editorial teams, journalists, and stakeholders to gather product requirements. - Conduct user research to understand audience preferences and pain points. 3. Product Roadmap Development: - Create and maintain a clear and prioritized product roadmap. - Balance short-term and long-term goals while considering resource constraints. 4. Cross-functional Collaboration: - Work closely with engineering, design, content, and marketing teams to execute the product vision. - Serve as a bridge between technical and non-technical teams. 5. Product Development and Release: - Define detailed product requirements and user stories. - Oversee the development process, ensuring that products are delivered on time and within scope. - Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure quality. 6. User Experience (UX) and Design: - Collaborate with designers to create user-friendly and engaging interfaces. - Iterate on design and user experience based on user feedback and data 7. Data-Driven Decision Making: - Analyse user data, engagement metrics, and feedback to make informed product decisions. - A/B testing and user behaviour analysis to optimize features. 8. Product Launch and Marketing: - Develop go-to-market strategies and coordinate product launches. - Work with the marketing team to create compelling messaging and campaigns. 9. Performance Monitoring: - Continuously monitor product performance and user satisfaction. - Identify issues and opportunities for improvement. 10. Compliance and Security: - Ensure that the platform complies with legal and security standards, such as GDPR and data protection regulations. 11. Stakeholder Communication: - Provide regular updates to stakeholders on the progress of product development. - Address feedback and concerns proactively. Qualifications and Skills: - Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus. - Proven experience as a Product Manager in the digital news media or content delivery industry. - Strong understanding of digital media trends, audience behaviour, and technology. - Exceptional project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. - Proficiency in using product management and collaboration tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Trello). - Analytical mind-set with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Knowledge of agile development methodologies is preferred. Attributes: - Visionary: Ability to envision the future of digital news media products. - Customer-Centric: Focus on meeting audience needs and enhancing user experience. - Problem Solver: Creative problem-solving skills to address challenges and seize opportunities. - Leadership: Ability to lead cross-functional teams and inspire colleagues. - Adaptability: Willingness to adapt to a fast-paced and evolving media landscape. You will play A Product Manager a pivotal role in delivering high-quality news content to a digital audience while ensuring the product's success and relevance in a competitive market
column11: Product Roadmap, Product Launch, Product Strategy, Product Development, User Experience Design, Product Life Cycle

column2: Introduction We are a dynamic and innovative platform headquartered in Mumbai, India. Our platform empowers individuals and non-profits to raise funds for Healthcare, education, and other initiatives. We believe in democratizing access to capital and fostering a community-driven approach to get funds for whoever is in need. As a Product Manager for our crowdfunding platform, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our product and driving its growth. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, design, marketing, and operations to enhance the user experience, drive engagement, and optimize the platform and Business. Responsibilities: Product Strategy:  Develop and execute product strategies aligned with the companys vision and goals. Conduct market research, analyze user feedback, and identify opportunities for product improvement and innovation. Roadmap Planning:  Create and maintain a product roadmap that prioritizes feature development and enhancements based on business objectives, user needs, and market trends. Feature Development:  Collaborate with engineering and design teams to define product requirements, user stories, and specifications. Drive the end-to-end development process from concept to launch, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality features. User Experience Optimisation:  Continuously monitor key metrics and user feedback to identify pain points and areas for improvement in the user experience. Implement usability testing, A/B testing, and other methodologies to optimize user engagement and conversion rates. Stakeholder Management:  Work closely with internal stakeholders, including marketing, operations, and customer support teams, to ensure alignment on product priorities, timelines, and goals. Communicate product updates and progress effectively across the organization. Competitive Analysis:  Keep abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in crowdfunding and related fields. Leverage insights to inform product decisions and maintain a competitive edge. Performance Tracking:  Define KPIs and success metrics for product initiatives. Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, user behavior data, and market trends to measure the impact of product changes and drive continuous improvement. Requirements: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field. MBA or advanced degree is a plus. 2+ years of experience in product management, preferably in a technology-driven company or a crowdfunding platform. Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data insights into actionable product recommendations. Proven track record of successfully managing the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from ideation to launch. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels. Passion for entrepreneurship, innovation, and making a positive impact in the community. Experience with agile development methodologies and project management tools is desirable. Why Join Us: Opportunity to work at the forefront of the crowdfunding industry and drive positive change in the lives of millions of people. Collaborative and entrepreneurial work environment with a diverse and talented team. Room for growth and career advancement as we continue to expand our platform and reach. If you are passionate about product management, have a knack for innovation, and want to be part of a mission-driven company, wed love to hear from you. Join us in revolutionizing crowdfunding and impact lives in a positive way. Apply now!

column1: Manager of Product Management - Product Engineering & Delivery
column2: The role of Manager of Product, Engineering & Delivery (Product Management) is responsible for all facets of a product / solution delivery including Product Management, Engineering and Delivery with an individual focus on Product Management      The Manager of Product Management is responsible for defining and supporting the building of desirable, feasible, viable, and sustainable products that meet our customer needs over the product lifecycle      This role collaborates with a wide range of people, including Senior Management      and Business Leaders to identify and define customer needs, understand the Solution Context, and develops the Program Vision, Roadmap, and Features required to meet these needs including assurance that bus needs cascades down to the team level      And owns the feature product backlog and serves as the ultimate product authority approving PI/TI and Iteration objectives      This role also owns the Engineering team and Delivery supporting a complete SAFe Agile ART cycle and lead the team on end-to-end delivery      This role will have the Engineering Managers and Product Owners and Scrum Masters reporting in as part of the Agile process      As the leader of multiple teams, they have a strong focus on coaching, mentoring, developing and growing Product and Engineering talent, and championing an engineering mindset, agile practices and adherence to Company and industry standards      This person as the people leader is responsible for the team delivering on a set of products from India      And as a people leader support their staff with their product, technical and functional expertise and career growth/development              Major Responsibilities          Partners with key stakeholders & IT leaders (including engineering managers) across all levels to understand current experiences, identify areas of opportunity, and drive solutions to meet business needs.      Develop vision/strategy, product lifecycle management, backlog management / prioritization, business case development, and cost/benefit analysis.      Generates business value work with the Portfolio layer including working with the PO to assure that the work cascades down to the team level including driving and approving PI/TI Iteration/Sprint objectives.      Accountable for crafting and delivering the Product roadmap for Merchandise Solutions, partnering with Business Stakeholders, Architecture, and Engineering teams to ensure alignment to Business Strategies, Technical Roadmaps, and Architectural standards.      Collaboratively create and align partners to a well-articulated global product vision and strategic roadmap.      Accountable for the end-to-end management and delivery of complex technical Epics, or technical aspects of larger Epics to achieve business outcomes that may span more than one product team or technical domain.      Champions IT-driven initiatives amongst IT leadership to enable alignment to a technical roadmap or strategy.      Applies SAFe principles, Kanban and Scrum framework including embracing of agile principles & a lean agile mindset and proficient in use of agile process & tools.      Understands & is able to implement / support engineering best practices, methodology and standards such has DevOps, Automation & Security best practices and can collaborate with platform teams.      Lead, mentor, coach and develop a team of skilled and engaged Product, Engineering and Delivery teams at various levels of seniority, ensuring they have the skills, tools, and processes to deliver high-quality IT products and services.      Key participant in supporting and reviewing system demos to ensure demonstrated delivered work aligns with targeted bus value deliverables & scope.      Partners with companion teams for delivery of enterprise connected solutions.      Anticipate demand and lead the hiring of skilled internal & external talent for the Merchandise Solutions delivery team.      Accountability for the end-to-end delivery of Epics, Features, Stories and/or Programs to achieve business outcomes.      Evolve lean and agile process and operationalized product management workflows while leaving room for flexibility and team-specific ways of working.      Responsible for managing vendor relationships including expertise in ensuring targeted vendor deliverables meet our product needs including timely alignment.      Drives product innovation and motivates / engages the team to bring new ideas and improve existing processes.      Knowledgeable and supportive regarding creation & execution of product SOWs.      Participant & reviewer of RFPs.      Responsible for ensuring that Value Streams are creating feasible and sustainable products & solutions.      Works effectively with all levels and roles including fully understanding R&Rs of the PO, team, stakeholders & other teams.      People Manager with direct reports including alignment & adherence to HR compliance regarding staff management.          Minimum Qualifications          12+ years of IT experience      Proven experience and success in delivering IT products.      Experience working in a SAFe Agile environment.      Prior experience and ability to lead complete solution delivery teams (across Product, Engineering and Delivery) and bringing in best practices working with global teams.          Preferred Qualifications          Understanding of the Oracle Retail platform and working with Retail Merchandising processes.      Prior experience owning and delivering large scale products.      SAFe Certified Scrum Product Owner/Product Manager (POPM) preferred.      Evidence of having strong, collaborative relationships with Customers, Product Owners, Epics Owners.      Understanding of Epic/Feature refinement, story point estimation process.
column11: Product management, Automation, Product engineering, Assurance, Product innovation, Director, Agile, Scrum, Solution delivery, Oracle Retail

column2: The Pre-Sales Engineer is the face of Infoworks product and technical capabilities to both business and technical prospects       They are a valued technical expert and partner to the Sales team     Providing pre-sales technical support to customers and prospects that are evaluating Infoworks products, you will use in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise to sales counterparts, customers and prospects through technical sales presentations and product demonstrations     In addition, you will work closely with your sales counterparts to assess potential application of company products to meet customer needs through the creation of detailed solution architectures for complex data engineering and analytics use cases       The ideal candidate will have the ability to listen, empathize, and uncover true pain points, translating business needs into demonstrable solutions     You will partner with customers and prospects to help them build proof of concepts that demonstrate the feasibility of the software, often requiring rapid prototyping and/or product demos for the client     This role requires travel to customer locations up to, and may exceed, 25% of the time, based on the needs of the business              Who You Are                   Customer oriented and sales driven individual.             Skilled in data management, data warehousing, data orchestration, and data integration technologies.             Self-motivated and organized to learn and apply new technologies to craft solutions meeting client needs.             Understand and enjoy working with data and data technologies from databases, ETL data governance, and business intelligence tools.             Thrive in an environment where you can take ownership of a variety of projects and see them through to completion.             A builder of solutions based on a true understanding of customer requirements demonstrating feasibility of the application, often requiring rapid prototyping and/or product demo for client.             Able to demonstrate past contributions in providing product support in the enterprise software sales cycle with a clear ability to link technical features to business outcomes.                    What You'll Do                   Own the technical presales process and ensure the success of POCs conversion to opportunities.             Own and manage the development, delivery and/or orchestration of technical activities driving toward technical validation, technical selection and technical closure with the customer.             Use in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise to sales and customers through sales presentations, POCs, and product demonstrations.             Provide consultation, product capability assessment, and validation to prospective users.             Assist sales in assessing potential application of company products to meet customer needs and prepare detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of customer products / applications / solutions.             Capture requested features and feedback information to the Product Management, Engineering, and Marketing teams.             Lead executive-level technical demonstrations at large enterprise organizations articulating our value proposition.              Deliver in-depth online and in-person demonstrations of our solution as well as at field events such as conferences, seminars, etc.              Assist in the development, validation and maintenance of sales materials, knowledge bases, product documentation and tutorial videos.                   Required Skills and Experience                   5 -7 years of customer facing experience in presales or sales engineering of enterprise software solutions, as well as supporting implementations.             Experience and deep understanding of technology and solutions selling.             Demonstrated technical experience in cloud big data technologies and environments: [SQL, RDBMS, data warehouses, Data quality, MDM, BI tools, DataBricks, Hadoop, Python] and [Azure, AWS, Google].             Experience with industry leading data integration tools such as Informatica, Talend, Fivetran, Matillion, Azure Data Factory, and AWS Glue is a plus.             Expert-level presentation, customer service, financial/business acumen, and negotiation skills at all levels of customer engagement.             Ability to learn new technical subject matter quickly.             Ability to be flexible and to adapt to changing, situations, tools, and requirements             Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills             Bachelors Degree in computer science or related discipline             Ability to travel

column2: Market situation analysis    Leads market intelligence   analysis.  Understands and defines current   market segmentation and related offering positioning including relevant   regulations and standards e.g. on HSE or cyber security (both external and   ABB internal).  Identifies potential gaps in   portfolio, both against competition and new market opportunity   Existing products    Owns the technical and market   specification for the offering and determines a offering business plan that   supports sustainable growth.  Leads life cycle management   process, analyses current offering, defines and tracks performance metrics,   plans appropriate measures (e.g. enhancements, cost reductions, phase-outs)   and makes decisions on offering obsolescence and end-of life to ensure   current and future market requirements are met and maximize profitability.   Internal/external interface    Acts as interface between   external market and internal functions (e.g. Sales, Operations, and Research   & Development), forecasting volume trends on a regular basis to ensure   Operations capability to fulfil customer orders.  Sets targets and monitors   offering costs, giving inputs to Operations functions (e.g. Supply Chain   Management, Engineering, Production) to maximize competitiveness and   profitability.   New product development    Contributes to development of new   portfolios by leading customer need and value analysis, planning the roadmap   to create maximum value, follow-up of offering portfolio performance.   Product market communications    Initiates and drives product   market communication strategy, including product launch planning and   implementation.  Manages different channel to   market scenarios in coordination with channel partners and Marketing &   Sales to ensure best market coverage.   Product values    Defines product customer value   proposition per segment and channel and ensures clear communication to   channels and users, to deliver clear offering positioning within the   portfolio with defined values per offering line.   Offering to market & pricing   management    Responsible for offering   profitability and margin.  Drives the annual business   planning process and facilitates agreement between sales demand and supply.  Monitors global sales target   fulfilment and tender volumes and takes action as appropriate.  In preparation for new product   launch, and otherwise as required, defines pricing strategies and manages   global frame agreements and/or large scale cross border projects to ensure   one ABB approach.   Process development and training    Continuously develops product   management processes and tools, including interfaces to other key functions   and develops sales and tendering tools to support the Sales organization.  Initiates creation of external   and internal product training modules and programs.   Sustainability    Creates a Sustainability strategy   for the global Offering portfolio, supporting ABB's commitment to circular   economy.   Local scope - Product lifecycle,   Profitability, Product monitoring, Analysis, Sales support, R&D,   Marketing plan, People leadership and development    Manages new offering launch and   life cycle from phase-in to phase-out. Coordinates and supervises the product   road map.  Defines and oversees recovery   plans as necessary.  Responsible for the profitability   and life cycle of offering by defining pricing guidelines and market   position.  Oversees inventory levels and   sales volumes on a regular basis to ensure ability to fulfil customer orders.  Tracks and analyzes offering   performance and trends in terms of volume and profitability.  Coordinates analysis to evaluate   market and contribute to marketing plan development.  Understands relevant regulations   and standards e.g. on HSE or cyber security (both external and ABB internal).  Ensures technical and commercial   support to Sales force for critical or special negotiations.  Works with Research &   Development (R&D) to propose and evaluate product feasibility projects   and roadmaps for new offering and variants.  Collaborates with internal   Marketing and Sales teams to define the marketing plan, including marketing   communication activities, training activities and sales initiatives.  Ensures (with HR Manager support)   that the area of responsibility is properly organized, staffed, skilled and   directed.  Guides, motivates and develops   direct and indirect subordinates within HR policies.
