column2: About Us: Element5 is the worlds first Workflow Automation Solution purpose-built for post-acute care. Element5 helps automate complex and repetitive tasks that enable teams to prioritize patient outcomes over administrative work, saving valuable time.   Were fast-paced, supercharged, and led by industry veterans who have built several successful healthcare and IT products and are now on a mission to transform work across post-acute care. Were a two-time CBInsights Digital Health 150 Honor Roll awardee and the 2022 Homecare Innovator of the Year. With nearly $50 million in funding, Element5 is headquartered in San Jose, CA and operates with teams spread across the globe.   What are we looking for Element5 is looking for a Product Manager to take the wheel in driving end-to-end conceptual and technical product development for our workflow automation solutions. The right person needs to be customer-obsessed, entrepreneurial, analytical, strategic yet execution-focused, and passionate about rethinking work through automation. If you are seeking an organization whose values and actions support your growth and guide your daily actions, we want to work with you.   What your role will look like Driving product discovery, market research, and competitor research Driving innovation and new product development initiatives Communicating product vision and strategy to stakeholders Define, lead, prioritize and execute holistic product strategy in alignment with the business goals. Ensuring the product goals align with the overall business goals and company strategy Define key objectives and to-be state, identify success factors, and comprehend constraints, challenges, and risks Own the product backlog and constantly evolve it based on the latest changes in the business Collaborate across regions, product areas, and functions to formulate problem statements, develop product launch strategies, and create product messaging and training Generate ideas and content for solutions, unearth clients' pain points and validate business opportunities Ability to guide incremental delivery of a complex modernization project Drive the pace and quality of decisions on the software delivery team Structure and lead strategic conversations/meetings with cross-functional stakeholders Define, track, and report on the key product, business, and customer metrics   What's in it for you? Build an innovative, one-of-its-kind SAAS product team to revolutionize a niche healthcare segment Bring your ideas to the table and take ownership of end-to-end product development implementing various cutting-edge technologies and research solutions Lead the product team to ensure delivery of reliable solutions of flawless quality, ensuring perfect alignment with the customers and our business needs  Closely contribute to an aggressively growing organization?? scale, strategy, direction, and growth. Work in a transparent, collaborative culture that truly believes ??very idea has merit in it?? and bring your best innovation, and ideas forward. Work with a network of global teams and experienced leaders in healthcare  Develop an entrepreneurial, customer-obsessed mindset to work in an interesting, complex and fast-paced environment Collaborate with, mentor, and inspire some of the industry?? best and brightest. Element5?? team is built of radical individuals with armoires of achievements.   What we ask you bring with you At least 5+ years of experience leading product management teams In-depth understanding of the complete Product Management Life Cycle Experience in frameworks like ??obs to be Done??Experience with end-to-end delivery of product handling all stakeholders across different geographies A proactive, disruptive attitude towards technology innovation with the ability to take ownership and accountability to drive result-based execution Experience in translating a product vision into a roadmap with clear measures of success Analytical and data-driven; ability to rely on data to recognize what?? happening and define & measure success on every project Convert ideas to prototypes and demonstrate them to the key partners. Exposure to service design, user experience (UX), user needs research etc Familiar with modern technologies such as AWS, Azure or GCP Experience in (one of) Application Modernization, Platform Engineering or Developer Experience Advocate and evangelize Agile, Lean, and Continuous Delivery and Analysis best practices Strong communication skills, facilitation, prioritization and influencing skills Healthcare experience is a plus

column1: Manager / Asst. Manager - Marketing Insights and Operations
column2: Be the subject matter expert for multiple products from the    Zeta Opportunity Explorer    suite of products.   Analyze the data with thousands of attributes to identify potential opportunities to create new products and enhance the capabilities of existing ones.   Plan and prioritize product developments based on overall business priorities.   Create appropriate product wireframes and get buy-in from all stakeholders.    Closely work with design team to bring rudimentary designs to life.   Work with a highly skilled team of data analysts to identify logic to slice and dice the data to identify opportunities to visualize in the UI.    Coordinate with backend technology teams to ensure timely creation of data files or API queries for use in the UI and help automate the processes involved.   Monitor and analyze usage of the products and formulate strategies to increase adoption and utilization.   Support creation of custom reports and analyses that unlock key client-specific insights. Strong critical thinking, project planning, prioritization and execution skills.     Deep understanding of business use cases.     Proficient in executing moderately difficult commands in MS Excel which are commonly used for data analysis.     Adept at data visualization using MS Office tools or BI tools like Tableau, Power BI etc., and capable of spotting actionable insights.     Ability to spot issues in raw or processed data, and expeditiously implement corrections for minor data-related issues.             Good to have Skills:         Ability to view the product from a UI/UX lens and provide actionable inputs to the web development team.     Exposure to building basic wireframes/visuals on tools like InVision, MS PowerPoint, Tableau etc.     Willingness to go the extra mile, to support team members in standard technical tasks.     Ability to spot opportunities around process improvement and automation of tasks, and guide team members working on those projects.

column2: Having found exceptional product/market fit, we re in the midst of transitioning from start-up to scale-up , and looking for a Product Marketing Manager to collaborate closely with product management, sales, and the broader marketing teams to drive inbound, GTM, and outbound initiatives.       Responsibilities         Drive revenue and improvements in conversion rates across B2B focus areas and new B2B product launches.         Manage projects and communications internally and with partners to achieve agreed-upon success metrics and internal KPIs         Conduct market search to understand the needs of buyers & develop market messaging & positioning that resonates with the target audience & also differentiates WareIQ in the logistics & supply chain tech space         Create materials (sales enablement tools, presentations, case studies, product content, etc.) for the defined segmentation         Help lead market requirements and go-to-market strategies across multiple products, geographies, and user/persona experiences, particularly around product launches         Utilize data like win-loss information to inform the marketing, sales, and production process with an accessible repository of insights; this can include pricing and packaging.         Research and analyze competition and own positioning for our B2B product, partner, and operational capabilities.         Be a trusted liaison that drives product offering and solution alignment for joint success with Marketing, Partnerships, Sales, Product, Engineering, Operations, and Leadership         Requirements         5+ years of product marketer, product manager experience, specifically in B2B e-commerce, logistics tech, or SaaS.         Proficient understanding of B2B ecommerce/logistics technology, vernacular, and landscape         Proven success in executing B2B marketing strategies and the ability to clearly articulate quantifiable impacts that benefited the company and the partner         Experience creating market positioning materials including sales enablement tools, presentations, case studies, whitepapers, customer videos, POVs, and thought leadership         Experience with hands-on integrated marketing programs, from which you can showcase a portfolio of GTM campaigns         Exceptional communication and presentation skills and a track record for delivering clear and compelling customer-facing materials in a technology sector         Strong attention to detail, highly entrepreneurial, creative, open-minded, persistent, and highly collaborative         Outstanding organizational and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and consistently deliver on key milestones         Experience with Salesforce, along with other sales and marketing tools like marketing automation platforms and conversational analytics tools         Skills       CRM, market research, website optimisation, social media marketing, GTM strategy, product launch, salesforce, HubSpot, competitor analysis

Prioritize what problems need to be solved now vs. later. Solution Discovery:  Facilitate collaborative brainstorming with design, business, and tech teams to generate innovative, technology-driven solutions. Build and test multiple prototypes to validate ideas and land on the winning approach. Product Detailing : Define detailed requirements and work collaboratively with a cross-functional team (design, product, program, business, analytics, etc.) to bring a product to life. Ensure high product quality through processes such as user acceptance testing, dogfooding, etc. Go-to-Market Planning : Partner with legal, compliance, business and marketing stakeholders to craft a go-to-market plan that drives product adoption and market success. Adoption & Metrics : Define and track relevant product metrics, analyze usage patterns, and formulate action plans to optimize performance and maximize value for customers and the business Roadmap Creation:  Proactively create a product roadmap for your area, anticipating customer and business needs at least 3 months ahead. column2: THE IDEAL CANDIDATE       ?     The ideal candidate is a self-starter, problem-solver and successful in combining technology and data into best-in-class outcomes. The candidate is energized by solving complex business problems and consistently effective in making high-judgement decisions at rapid pace amidst the frequent ambiguity that comes with charting a course of action with no precedent. Moreover, the ideal candidate is energized by an environment where strategy, innovation and decision-making are intentionally distributed, where candor, speed and data are highly valued and colleagues at all levels hold each other to unusually high standards on behalf of Quince customers.     ?       Responsibilities          The Product Manager is responsible for delivering a differentiated product that addresses a business need and represents a viable business opportunity. A key component of this role is ensuring that the product supports the company s overall strategy and goals. The Product Manager is ultimately responsible for managing the product throughout its lifecycle conception through end-of-life:         Define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap         Work closely with the business and engineering teams to optimize the ad-spend for maximum reach and return on ad-spend (ROAS)         Gather, manage, and prioritize business requirements and develop business case for new development of in-house Ad-Spend tracking and management          Work with business and technology teams to enable development of personalisation engine and audience segmentation for targeting and          with the data science team to plan experimentation roadmap          Keenly observe how ad-tech ecosystem is evolving, and how that impacts our future roadmap         Be the scrum master and the product owner (define stories and detailed specifications) in engineering sprints         Run beta and pilot programs with new products and features along with regular reviews with business teams to ensure that it meets the expectations         Sample Goals         Define the product roadmap (3 months, 6 months, 1 year) in the ad-tech space          Set up framework for analyzing effectiveness of ad-spend         Build low-touch processes, self-serve solutions, automation to eliminate the involvement of engineering in business-as-usual (BAU) activities - reduce engineering time spent in BAU activities to          Develop internal platform and operational dashboards for marketing managers for effective ad-spend management         Skills and Experience         Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products         Excellent written and verbal communication skills         Technical background         Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority         Passion to answer Product/Engineering questions with data         Overall 8+ years of experience with at least 4 years in product management role         Capable of tackling very loosely defined problems           Prior experience with ad-tech spend management platforms, integration with Google, FB ad-platforms, development of internal dashboards for ROAS optimization, SEO

The goal will be to add velocity to the PM function, and to exchange best practices where needed.            Afterwards    ... You will set up your own product team and lead it. You will get 1 to 3 Objectives and Key Results to achieve (for specified part of the overall product), and a product team to achieve the goals. From there, you will be mostly autonomous on how to achieve those goals.          We think about the Product Management role at this stage along these activities:            Product discovery    : Figure out what features need to be built.            Work with Design    : Collaborate with the Head of Design to produce designs, do 1on1s.            Define tasks to be built    : Write the tasks for the engineering team.            Managing Engineering    : Collaborate with the Engineering team, e.g. stand-ups, 1on1s.            Manual testing    : The PM role is currently doing the final manual testing before releasing.            Other ad-hoc activities    : such as planning how to scale the team, interviewing job candidates          Besides being relatively extreme in how results-oriented and hard-working we are, we are also very down-to-earth, practical and helpful. We also value highly contributions regardless of title or tenure. We hope you like those things as much as we do.      Your Profile                    Experience leading a software project (minimum 2-3 years, preferably 5+ years):            Working with the design team to make designs          Writing task specifications for the developers          Managing the developer team (stand-ups, 1on1s)          Doing manual testing                Excellent communication skills (incl. direct communication)              Excellent collaboration and teamwork skills              Very good people leadership/management skills              Very good organizational skills, structure and processes              Very driven and effective (top 20% performer and fast career trajectory)              Taking ownership and solving problems proactively              Would like to work at a dynamic, fast-scaling startup (3-5x growth per year).    With all the challenges of this (ambiguity, rapid decision-making, sometimes lack of data, internal capacity challenges).              Loves remote work and our product. Understands our product.            Nice-to-have skills:                    Experience from the recruiting products and/or marketplaces              Experience from teams that have a good automated testing setup              Experience from multi-team product organization and scaling product.              Product discovery skills (figuring out what tasks need to be built, e.g. qualitative and quantitative methods, product sense and experimentation)              Programming skills or technical understanding, the better              Design skills are not needed for this role, but still they are beneficial              Business skills and strategy skills are very beneficial

column2: This role is for a Digital Product and Solutions Architect responsible for supporting the growth and development of the Digital Products and Solution Practice within the ZS Technology Advisory and Services business       The successful candidate will work closely with ZS practice leadership and become trusted advisor and enabler for our clients to help them smoothly embrace digital and technology changes, align business process to product-centric platforms and partner with client IT organizations during the change process     Solution architects are savvy, strategic technology consultants that serve our large, global clients as we envision and design transformational digital IT strategies and solutions, driven by innovation in leading business platforms in Life Science and Healthcare Payer and Provider domain        Provide architectural point of views insights as part of a platform and product focused consulting services for our clients.         Evaluate and recommend appropriate best-in-class technologies, platforms, frameworks, products and accelerators to achieve desired outcomes.         Design and architect end-to-end digital solutions that address complex business challenges and drive value.         Develop architectural designs, technical specifications, and system integrations for digital products and the supporting platform services.         Lead the design and development of scalable, reliable, and secure digital architectures.               What you'll Do               Be a subject matter expert on technology advisory for product-fit and platform-fit within the big picture of the enterprise landscape.         Demonstrate leadership in Digital Product area by bringing all aspects of Product and Platform Architecture to clients and company.         Translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability of our digital products.         Work with business, IT and PMO stakeholders to conduct various activities in an agile collaborative manner managing the full product life cycle, from ideation to deploy, such as product evaluation, architectural-fit, platform capabilities, gap assessment, maturity mapping, implementation governance.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, developers, and QA engineers, to deliver high-quality digital products.         Ensure compliance with architectural best practices, standards, and guidelines.         Conduct technology assessments and proof-of-concepts to validate proposed solutions.         Stay current on latest platform solutions, emerging technologies, industry trends and solution patterns, and lead the effort to develop ZS POV and market scan for strategic decision-making and best practices in digital product solution.         Collaborate with various practices and service areas within ZS to help assure delivery excellence in pursuit to exceed client expectation of value delivered throughout the product lifecycle.         Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams throughout the project lifecycle.         Quickly assimilate new knowledge with deep Digital, Tech and business acumen.         Demonstrate executive-level presence and communication skills.         Willingness to travel to meet client needs. Ability to work across geographic boundaries to collaborate and support with global teams and clients.                       What you'll Bring               10+ years of experience in an IT or Business Consulting firm, with proficiency in Solution Architecture having proven expertise in Platform Configuration, System Integrations, Custom application development, Product customization and deployments.         Strong expertise in designing and implementing end-to-end digital solutions using modern technologies and architectures.         Extensive architectural expertise and business process understanding of CRM and Workflow development platforms, SFDC in specific functional domain.         Understanding of architectural principles, patterns methods related (but not limited) to Web, Databases, API lead design, microservices, interoperability and other integration technologies.         Experience in digital transformation, specifically in the areas of customer engagement and digital experience.         Reasonable depth of domain knowledge, either in Life sciences Commercial space or HealthCare Payer Provider function, having familiarity with reference architectures and first-hand experience with leading vendor platforms in this space.         Deep understanding of product development methodologies, tools, and techniques.         Familiarity with cloud platforms and related applications, web and mobile development frameworks in delivering client needs is desirable.         Strong product mindset to envision solution offerings as products from start to the last mile associated with a client problem area.         Knowledge of industry regulations and compliance requirements (at a global scale is nice to have).         Certifications in relevant technologies (eg, Salesforce, TOGAF) are a plus.         Excellent presentation skills with a high degree of ability to communicate complex, forward-leaning technology concepts to ZS and its clients business leaders.         Proven ability to formulate and present strategic points of view on relevant industry trends.         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills         A strong work ethic and a willingness to travel to meet client needs.         A high level of motivation and self-starting attitude         Experience working in agile environments.         Ability to work independently and as part of a team.         Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work products.             Perks Benefits:             ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development.          Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths and collaborative culture empowers you to thrive as an individual and global team member.         We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working.          A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and on-site presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week.          The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.

Utilized market research and data insights to inform product decisions.  Collaborated with design and engineering teams to ensure user-centric design and product  development.  Created professional presentations using MS PowerPoint to communicate product strategies and updates.  Ensure alignment of technology stacks with product development needs.  Managed product development tools such as  JIRA,   Confluence,   and   Figma   to   streamline   the   development   process. What   You   Will   Do:   Product   Strategy : Develop and articulate a clear product strategy aligned with company goals  and market opportunities. Continuously assess market trends, competition, and customer  feedback to refine and adjust the product strategy as needed.   Product   Planning:  Define product roadmap and prioritize features and enhancements based on  business value, customer impact, and technical feasibility. Work closely with stakeholders, including engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams, to ensure alignment and successful execution.   Requirement   Gathering : Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze product  requirements, translating customer needs into actionable user stories, feature specifications,  and acceptance criteria. Maintain a prioritized backlog of tasks for development teams.   Product   Development : Lead cross-functional teams through the product development process,  from concept to launch. Provide guidance and direction to engineering, design, and other teams  to ensure timely delivery of high-quality products that meet or exceed customer expectations.   Release   Management:  Coordinate product releases and updates, including feature rollouts, bug fixes, and performance enhancements. Communicate release plans, timelines, and updates to internal teams and external stakeholders as needed.   Product   Marketing : Collaborate with the marketing team to develop go-to-market strategies,  positioning, messaging, and collateral to effectively promote and sell the product. Support sales  efforts with product training, demos, and competitive analysis.   Performance   Monitoring:  Define and track key product metrics and KPIs to assess product  performance, user engagement, and customer satisfaction. Analyze data and user feedback to  identify opportunities for improvement and inform future product decisions.   Stakeholder   Management:  Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external  stakeholders, including executives, customers, partners, and vendors. Act as the primary point of contact for product-related inquiries and updates.   Product   Evangelism : Serve as a passionate advocate for the product, both internally and externally. Champion the product vision, value proposition, and roadmap to drive enthusiasm and support across the organization and customer base.

column2: Nature of Job:    Remote        Overall Job Function:        The Product Manager will work with the CEO, CGO and engineering team. This person is excited by the exposure offered at a small, fast-growing company and likes participating in strategy discussions just as much as owning ideas through execution. As we grow, this person has the opportunity to build out and manage the product team. To start, they ll have one junior PM as a direct report, supporting execution and will hire and manage a visual designer.        Job Requirements and Responsibilities:          Deep UX and data implementation experience, comfortable bringing concepts to wireframes and owning the full UX. They will be working with a visual designer to translate ideas to dev-ready assets.      Responsible for creating and owning the product roadmap and will be accountable for setting, monitoring and executing all product goals, writing product stories and managing asset creation and implementation. They will have the support of Junior PM on execution.      Comfortable working at the executive level with the CEO and CGO to translate ideas into the product roadmap, while also bringing their own point of view for new features and iterations, ensuring Loop & Tie is continually innovating and leading as a customer engagement tool.      Managing both the Loop & Tie app as well as the Salesforce app and any additional integrations.      Data-driven, defining measurable success metrics with business owner, and driving alignment for all product efforts to those measures.      Lead feature-based research efforts including integrations to understand optimal use of internal tools          Candidate Qualifications:          A proven track record of success in building and shipping impactful software products and features at a high-growth technology company.      Comfortable with a significant amount of autonomy both in a work environment (we run a remote team, even when there aren t pandemics) and in making product decisions. Ability to define and prioritize initiatives while working cross-functionally, and managing complex stakeholder relationships.      Brings a collaborative mindset with the user-needs at the forefront. Manages the expectations of internal and external users by prioritizing, and communicating your product requirements and vision and being open to feedback and quick strategy pivots.      Desire to scale in a lean environment.      A curiosity to leverage our small, fast-growing dynamic to contribute to all aspects of the business. We want to hear your thoughts on business development, partnerships, integrations and operational improvements. We want you to feel comfortable wearing many hats and brainstorming beyond traditional product conversations.      An entrepreneurial mindset - you roll up your sleeves, thrive in chaos, and get things done.      Familiarity running inception meetings and writing epics and stories, using the pivotal framework is a coup.      Familiarity running post-launch rehashes and assessing data and success overtime.      Experience in B2B B2C products and SaaS businesses, Experience with ecommerce companies, marketing or engagement tools (like Hubspot) is a coup          What You Get:          Fully remote role, so you can work from home      3 weeks vacation a generous company Holiday calendar      Wellness & Education benefits      Dental and health insurance      Equity

column2: In this role, you'll be managing the Interviews product, which helps hundreds of thousands of interviewers conduct meaningful live coding interviews, and make confident hiring decisions. you'll have the opportunity and responsibility to scale this business by thinking outside the box to unlock deep value for our users and buyers. column1: Sr Inbound Product Manager- Cloud Observability
column2: Were looking for a passionate, driven Senior Product Manager to define product vision and lead the development of innovative Cloud Observability and analytics solutions for the ServiceNow Cloud.      These solutions will empower internal operations and development teams by providing:       Real-time access to service telemetry data for faster troubleshooting and root cause analysis.     Advanced machine learning capabilities for proactive anomaly detection and performance optimization.       Youll drive the product roadmap, prioritize features based on user needs, and collaborate with geographically distributed engineering teams to deliver solutions that:       Reduce mean time to resolution (MTTR) for incidents.      Increase uptime of critical ServiceNow applications.      Improve developer productivity through faster issue identification.        What you get to do in this role:        Conceptualize and drive execution of end-to-end Observability and analytics solutions leveraging telemetry data from the ServiceNow platform.     Deliver quick prototypes (eg, wireframes) to validate user needs and demonstrate solution value.      Own product delivery, defining user stories with clear acceptance criteria and working with development teams to ensure successful implementation.      Partner with internal operations and development teams to understand user personas and pain points related to ServiceNow observability.     Continuously improve product development processes by establishing repeatable workflows and collaborating with teams for optimal efficiency.                     To be successful in this role, you have:         A minimum of 5 years of experience in product management or a related field, with a focus on Observability and Analytics solutions.     Experience building cloud-based products and understanding of SaaS delivery models.     Strong user research and product strategy skills.     Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, operations) to bring products to market.     A bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a closely related field (or equivalent experience).         Preferred Qualifications:         Experience working with (or in) operations or SRE teams.     Familiarity with commercial observability offerings (e.g., Honeycomb, New Relic, Datadog, Splunk).
column11: Product management, Root cause analysis, data science, Machine learning, Cloud, splunk, Troubleshooting, Analytics, Product strategy

column1: Principal Inbound Product Manager - Order Management
column2: The Principal Inbound Product Manager, resides within the product organization. This role is extraordinarily collaborative, working not only with the inbound product team, but cross-functionally with outbound product managers, design, research, engineering, quality engineering, documentation, product success, operations, and more.          What you get to do in this role:        If you are passionate about leading the product s direction, getting to know the customers, being intimate with the problems users have, executing planning and releases, and building products customers love, this role is for you! In it, you will:      Drive product strategy:        Evaluate customer pain points, research insights, usage and adoption data, and competitive and market intel to develop a point of view on product priorities.      Write business cases for investments and deliver these insights in executive facing meetings.      Build and manage a backlog of customer and/or market validated ideas and requirements which translate to a clear minimum viable product with differentiators.      Explore and pitch inorganic methods of providing solutions which solve problems for customers.        Execute planning and releases:        Work with user experience and engineering teams to bring ideas to life.      Communicate complex problems in easily understood requirements.      Validate product designs and prototypes with customers.      Collaborate with other ServiceNow product teams to resolve and execute cross-team dependencies.      Collaborate with engineering on release management: understand status, risks, dependencies and help address risks and resolve issues.      Ensure successful delivery of product releases.        Product enablement and success:        Collaborate with outbound product management, sales, marketing, product success, education services and other teams to cement customer success.      Develop enablement collateral which helps to create the whole product."        Engage with and champion the customer:        Understand how customers are using the product as well as trends such as reasons for lack of adoption or low usage and barriers to success.      Be voice of customer, providing their perspective on value throughout product development lifecycle.      Run design partnerships with top 5-10 strategic customers          To be successful in this role you have:          Have 10+ years of inbound or technical product management experience.      Have deep experience in Order Management and its related processes.      Bonus points if you have knowledge of additional areas like CPQ.      Have strong experience in building products within a platform led organization      Have experience managing enterprise architecture and third-party integrations.      Strong prioritization skills and the discipline to focus on high-impact activities. This means ability to say no while articulating your reasons for prioritization.      Experience gathering and capturing product requirements and transforming them into a product roadmap. This includes ability to identify and prioritize problems before creating solutions.      Strong written and oral communication skills to be able to convey technical and business concepts at a level appropriate to the audience.      Deep curiosity about customer needs and a track record in building customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.      Agile and/or Scrum experience; certification is not required.      Think strategically, learn fast and communicate with impact.      Should be able to influence and create alignment across cross-functional teams without formal authority.      Ability to think critically, solving complex problems.      Thrive in ambiguity and operate fluently.      Ability to travel up to 20% of the year.
column11: Product management, Order management, Outbound, Usage, Sales, Enterprise architecture, Agile, Scrum, After sales support, Release management

column2: A graduate with 36-48 months experience with the desire to build a career in an innovative and high performing business overseeing a brand held in high esteem by the furniture industry     We will also consider those with good A level grades supported by 18 - 24 Months experience     Experience gained from a sandwich degree will be considered         Purpose of the job         To provide critical support for the development and growth of the relevant Herman Miller portfolio, and support the offer management team to ensure that this product line achieves its objectives in terms of sales volume and profitability.     The job title is Associate Product Manager and the role covers the same basic activities and responsibilities as a Product Manager, but with training and coaching on the job.     It s an excellent opportunity for someone with 18-24 months experience in a marketing, finance or product role to gain experience and develop in a central, cross-functional position.         Specific responsibilities         New product introduction. Support new product launches, working with the relevant Product manager(s), developing a business case and leading the introduction of those products, including vocabulary definition and PDM/EOS/CET setup.     Product expertise. Intimate knowledge of the products within your portfolio, to ensure that you can speak with authority about them, and provide technical or sales support where necessary. This covers technical information (construction/materials), standards conformance, vocabulary information, CMF, pricing, margins, inventory policy, competitive products, market statistics etc.     Maintenance activities. Responsible for accuracy and availability of information concerning allocated portfolio available to the international sales team and dealer community     Project/dealer support. Supports sales activity - particularly in the case of major projects. Also involved in discussions with major clients on product or service issues.     Communications. Associate Product manager works with Marketing Communications team to define requirements for their projects. They are responsible for checking and approving all such communications activity under supervision from the Product Manager.     Competition. Detailed knowledge of competitive products for benchmarking exercises and to help you develop sales arguments against the competition, both in terms of the products and their price/value relationships.         Resource management            Financial:    Prepare capital approval requests resulting from business plans. Work with communication and sales colleagues on marketing budgets. Able to work within multi-disciplinary teams of people on development, cost-saving and product maintenance projects. Comfortable working as part of a team of professionals.     Able to manage multiple projects and prioritise.     Able to write English clearly and concisely.     Able to articulate own thoughts clearly and persuade others.     Able to lead decision making meetings without the formal structural authority. column2: \As an Associate Product Manager, you play a pivotal role in shaping the success of a major Canadian retail website. Your responsibilities span various domains, from strategic planning to product launch, and includes product vision and strategy, execution and delivery, stakeholder management, customer collaboration, metrics and KPI s, and risk management.     As a Product Manager, you re not just building digital features; you are crafting delightful experiences that resonate with customers and drive business growth. Your ability to balance vision, execution, and collaboration will help define the success of the retail website.                 What you will do                   Product Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive product strategy aligned with business goals, market trends, and customer needs in the retail industry.                     Market Research: Conduct market research to identify consumer trends, competitors, and opportunities for product innovation.                     Roadmap Development: Create and manage product roadmaps that prioritize features, enhancements, and new product launches based on customer insights and business objectives.                     Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with design, engineering, marketing, and sales teams to define product requirements, ensure timely delivery, and maximize product adoption.                     Product Development: Lead the product development process from concept to launch, ensuring the delivery of high-quality products on time and within budget.                     User Experience: Advocate for exceptional user experiences by supporting user testing, gathering feedback, and iterating on product designs and features.                     Metrics and Analysis: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success, analyze data, and make data-driven decisions to optimize product performance. column2: Title: Sr. Product Manager Location: Gurgaon, India Job Description Who We Are: Fareportal is a travel technology company powering a next-generation travel concierge service. Utilizing its innovative technology and company owned and operated global contact centers, Fareportal has built strong industry partnerships providing customers access to over 600 airlines, a million lodgings, and hundreds of car rental companies around the globe. With a portfolio of consumer travel brands including CheapOair and OneTravel, Fareportal enables consumers to book-online, on mobile apps for iOS and Android, by phone, or live chat. Fareportal provides its airline partners with access to a broad customer base that books high-yielding international travel and add-on ancillaries.  Fareportal is one of the leading sellers of airline tickets in the United States. We are a progressive company that leverages technology and expertise to deliver optimal solutions for our suppliers, customers, and partners. FAREPORTAL HIGHLIGHTS: Fareportal is the number 1 privately held online travel company in flight volume.  Fareportal partners with over 600 airlines, 1 million lodgings, and hundreds of car rental companies worldwide.  2019 annual sales exceeded $5 billion.  Fareportal sees over 150 million unique visitors annually to our desktop and mobile sites. Fareportal, with its global workforce of over 2,600 employees, is strategically positioned with 9 offices in 6 countries and headquartered in New York City.  Job Description and Responsibilities: The Product manager will align the business vision, market and competitor trends, customer feedback and business analytics to create, prioritize, and execute a roadmap that delivers sustainable business growth and meets the Financial goals and targets for that specific business. This product is related to helping our customers who have already booked one travel product with us, such as flight, discover and book other travel products with us, such as a hotel stay or a car rental. The Product manager will work with various stakeholders to combine different needs and goals to support the creation of a coherent product strategy.   Ownership of the Product, including P&L responsibility.   Own and optimize customer journeys for the attachment of Trip Attach bookings  Go-to person to explain movement of key Trip Attach KPIs.   Hands-on participation to create and improve attachment and revenue KPIs for Trip Attach by working with development, design, marketing, data science, analytics and other teams as needed.   Work directly with the dedicated development team, run scrums, plan their sprints and participate in routine discussions to address questions on the proposed user stories.   Coordinate with Core-Air team and Marketing teams to optimize bookings from Trip Attach pathways  Partner with Core-Car and Core-Hotel teams to develop effective strategies to grow Trip Attach bookings Lead research, metrics gathering, competitive and performance analyses of products listed above, and communicate results across the company.   Author and publish requirements, identify and outline the needs to increase attachment, convert findings to clearly defined user stories so they are easily executed by the technology team   Become a key member of the Fareportal Product team, ensuring our Trip Attach product aligns with customers' needs and overall company strategy.   Complete ongoing competitive analysis to ensure that we are providing top-tier products and customer experiences for our customers.   Prioritize mix of minor necessary enhancements and new innovations/revenue/cost opportunities   Identify and communicate status, blockers, risks, and mitigation strategies to appropriate teams as needed   Improve accuracy and the quality of data on internal reports and google analytics around Trip Attach. Improving data collection, utilizing big data, and providing requirements to develop custom reports.   Build products that rate highly by customers (NPS > 75) and deliver commercial growth for Fareportal.   Lead daily Product quality checks (price checks, customer experience, site speed and functionality, content quality, customer feedbacks, etc.)   Collaborate with pricing team and oversee Trip Attach, pricing analysis with Fare Data Analysis team.   Ensure NPS, DOT, NAD, BBB, AG and all Legal compliance for the Trip Attach product portfolio.   Collaborate with operations and call center teams, and act as the Business Lead/owner for the Trip Attach operations teams. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Ownership :   Ownership of Trip Attach Product, including P&L   Trip Attach Pathways--Online, Desktop, Mobile and Call-center ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Qualifications :   Masters in Comp Science/ Industrial Engineering or MBA in IT/ Ecommerce is preferred   At least 6 years experience in a Product Management role preferably in Travel Product ownership that includes P&L responsibility.   Strong Business Intelligence, analytical, data interpretation and problem-solving skills.   Well versed in scientific method and hypothesis based AB Testing and product development.   Mastery with A/B testing and tools, with a strong understanding of data-driven decision-making   Good product innovation skills   Must be a champion of new innovative ideas that drive competitive parity and superiority   A strong understanding of current web technologies, standards, and how the web ecosystem is evolving.   Experience and success with Agile development concepts.   Strategic and holistic thinking to balance and prioritize short-term solutions with the long-term vision  A strong entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to rally internal support for ideas   Excellent leadership and communication skills   A strong design and usability sense driven by the ability to step into a user's shoes and advocate for them   Customer Centric mindset for product development with a track record of delivering and improving scalable consumer facing e-commerce experiences.   Excellent writing, organizational, and time management skills   Enthusiasm for working collaboratively on cross-functional teams and coordinating between them   Proven experience with full product SDLC, from concept to launch   Implementation experience across desktop, mobile and app development, and alignment in a B2C environment   Proven ability to define and execute a successful product and development roadmap   Ability to break high-level concept/projects into sprint deliverables.   Excellent hands-on analytical skills, with a proven ability of multi-tasking with minimal oversight   Experience developing and managing ongoing business relationships at multiple organizational levels and working in a dynamic cross-functional environment.   Demonstrated ability to design and deliver both formal and informal presentations to groups of all sizes Disclaimer This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Fareportal reserves the right to change the job duties, responsibilities, expectations or requirements posted here at any time at the Companys sole discretion, with or without notice.

column2: As a Senior Product Manager at Delphix, you ll work across our organization to find new solutions for our customers and the company. We believe that leadership comes at all levels and we expect all Product Managers to grow into leadership - both by example and across development and product teams. Product Management is both broad (market analysis to product implementation) and deep (data analysis, product knowledge, technical mastery) and we look for those who expect and demand excellence from themselves.            This role will be focused on our flagship Continuous Data product, specifically our database platform support across SQL Server, Postgres, SAP Hana, Cassandra, DB2, CockroachDB, and more. Data is our business and requires us to constantly innovate by onboarding new data sources and expanding the feature sets of existing data sources. Experience with relational and NoSQL databases in a DevOps context is preferred as you will work with experts in this complex domain.       ?       Roles & Responsibilities:         Build the product strategy and roadmap for specific Delphix products, informed by customer and market insights, competitive analysis, technical capability, and internal initiatives/assets     Lead and manage the full product lifecycle market analysis, requirements definition, delivery and testing, education, internal business readiness, and customer deployment      Perform in-depth market competitive analysis, and gather customer insights to develop product and competitive positioning     Be an expert on your product, industry, and competition and leverage that expertise to drive product innovation and capture market opportunities     Create and deliver product-specific and thought leadership content including blogs and webinars     Determine product pricing by utilizing market research data, understanding costs, anticipating volume, and pricing custom orders     Establish and execute winning go-to-market strategies and drive successful product adoption in collaboration with Sales, Marketing, Support, and Business Partners            Required Skills & Experience:         Excellent written and verbal skills     Strong proficiency in English is a must     Experience in an enterprise software product management position, ideally in database and DevOps domains     Deep comfort with technical systems     A computer science or other technical degree is not required but is a strong benefit     Able to gather, analyze, and confidently present relevant data     Able to work cross-functionally as a team member and influencer     A desire to push the envelope to improve yourself and your team     Availability to collaborate with global teams and customers across many timezones

column2: Job Summary We are looking for dynamic and experienced Group Product Manager responsible for identifying new product opportunities, developing business cases, and implementing positioning strategies within designated budgets and organizational guidelines to achieve the market share and revenue targets of the specific vertical. Overseeing the creation of promotional materials, conducting launch meetings, and ensuring effective marketing plan implementation. Providing mentorship to team members and collaborating with sales teams and healthcare professionals to drive Continuing Medical Education (CMEs), aiming to meet market share and revenue targets. ? Roles & Responsibilities ??You will be responsible for New Products conceptualization and planning by gathering feedback on unmet therapeutic needs, identifying new product opportunities, and presenting business cases to the vertical head and country head for timely product selection, aligning with long and short-term objectives. ??You will be responsible for New Products Launch Planning by preparing product manuals, designing positioning strategies, and overseeing successful product launches through effective communication and collaboration with regional sales teams. ??You will be responsible for Post-Launch Audit of New Products by coordinating with sales teams, reviewing performance, and initiating corrective actions when necessary to ensure new products meet or exceed sales projections. ??You will be responsible for Branding and Promotions by conducting market research, finalizing positioning strategies, and overseeing effective promotion strategies by collaborating with ad agencies and implementing marketing plans in alignment with business goals. ??You will be responsible for Continuing Medical Education (CME) Programs by identifying CME needs, inviting speakers and doctors, and ensuring successful execution of CME programs to establish lasting relationships with healthcare professionals. ??You will be responsible for leading and developing the team by conducting performance appraisals, mentoring team members, and collaborating with HR for recruitment and talent development to maximize team performance and retention. ??You will be responsible for sales planning and review by gathering feedback from regional sales manager (RSMs), devising region-specific strategies, and incorporating regional needs into the product plan to enhance overall performance.   Qualification Educational qualification -A graduate degree in any Science stream Minimum work experience - 7-10 years of experience in Product Management in pharmaceutical Skills & attributes Technical Skills  ??Understanding of Indian Pharmaceutical industry- competition, customer behaviour and prescription habits. ??Strategic mindset to develop and implement long-term product strategies that align with the company's overall business objectives. ??Analytical skills to assess market trends, competitor activities, and customer needs for the products in the portfolio. ??Financial management skills to develop and manage budgets, allocate resources effectively, and optimize cost control for the product portfolio. ??Excellent communication skills to convey complex scientific and medical information to diverse audiences, including healthcare professionals, internal teams, and stakeholders. ??Ability to analyze market data, clinical trial results, and sales performance to inform decision-making and product portfolio strategies. ??Ability to adapt to changes in the pharmaceutical market, including advancements in therapies, healthcare policies, and regulatory updates. Behavioural Skills : ??Proactive and visionary mind-set ??Strong networking skills ??Effective people management abilities ??Adaptability and change management skills ??Strategic orientation and decision-making capabilities   Additional Information About the Department Global Generics India Global Generics India business journey began in 1986. In the last three decades, we have grown as a trusted name in the healthcare industry and rank as one of the top 10 Pharma Companies in the Indian Pharma Market (IPM) as per IQVIA MAT (November 2022). Our commitment to Lead Ahead has helped us move ranks from 16th position to 10th position (IPM) in the last four years. We are a fast-growing organisation with double-digit growth and significant market share in domestic markets. Currently, we rank among the top 5 in oncology, anti-allergy and gastrointestinal diseases and the top 10 in a few other therapy areas. Our focus is on leveraging our digital capabilities, collaborations, innovations and inorganic opportunities to become the top 5 companies in the Indian Pharma Market. Benefits Offered At Dr. Reddy?? we actively help to catalyse your career growth and professional development through personalised learning programs. The benefits you will enjoy at Dr. Reddy?? are on par with the best industry standards. They include, among other things and other essential equipment, joining & relocation support, family support (Maternity & Paternity benefits), learning and development opportunities, medical coverage for yourself and your family, life coverage for yourself. Our Work Culture Ask any employee at Dr. Reddy?? why they come to work every day and they??l say, because Good Health Can?? Wait. This is our credo as well as the guiding principle behind all our actions. We see healthcare solutions not only as scientific formulations, but as a means to help patients lead healthier lives, and we??e always attuned to the new and the next to empower people to stay fit. And to do this, we foster a culture of empathy and dynamism. People are at the core of our journey over the last few decades. They have been supported by an enabling environment that buoys individual ability while fostering teamwork and shared success. We believe that when people with diverse skills are bound together by a common purpose and value system, they can make magic. For more details, please visit our career website at  https://careers.drreddys.com/#!/?

column2: Must have KSA (Knowledge Skills Abilities)    Extracting functional solutions with help of customer interviews and interactions.  Requirement specifications Product roadmap planning Wireframes preparation.  Product release management   Additional KSA for advantage  Knowledge and hands on experience of advanced requirement management tools such as Jira, Confluence, or specialized requirement management software.  Responsibilities A) Requirement identification & Management :  Using fundamentals of customer interviews techniques to gather insights and comprehend customer requirements effectively.  Synthesizing interview data into actionable items. Uses affinity mapping or journey mapping to organize and analyze customer feedback effectively.  Identifying common patterns or pain points from customer feedback.  Prioritizing information based on importance and feasibility from all stakeholders.  Understanding the purpose of wireframes in defining layout, structure, and functionality. Using tools such as Balsamiq, Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD for basic features or screens with simple features or functionalities. B)  Product Roadmap Planning :  Using fundamentals of product roadmap planning, including its purpose, key components and how it aligns with the overall product strategy.  Using prioritization frameworks such as MoSCoW or Impact Vs. Effort helping informed decisions. Working on the roadmap based on changing priorities, market conditions and feedback from customers and stakeholders.  C)  User Acceptance Testing : Grasping the fundamental purpose of UAT and its role in the product development process.  Identifying straightforward test cases for a product in collaboration with QA team. Think from the users perspective and outlining scenarios to test core functionalities.  Ensuring resolution on bugs found in UAT before releases. Prioritizing bugs based on severity (critical, major, minor) and likelihood (frequent, occasional, rare) D)  Release Management : Documenting release plans, schedules, and communicates them effectively with the development team and other stakeholders. Ensures all are aligned on the goals and timelines. Identifying potential risks that could impact the release schedule and how to mitigate them. This involves understanding dependencies, resource constraints, and other factors that could affect the release. Managing various stakeholders involved in the release process, including development teams, QA teams, marketing, sales, and customers. This includes managing expectations, resolving conflicts, and ensuring alignment on priorities.
column11: Product Management, Product Roadmap, Release Management, Product Strategy, User Acceptance Testing, Wireframing, Product Innovation, Business Analyst, Release Strategy, Requirement Gathering, UAT

column2: In this role, you will be joining the Product Management team reporting to the Director of Product Management. The Product Management function at Highspot is an integral part of the company. You will be jumping into many different projects and features, and will be very hands-on. You will be working very closely with design, user research and engineering to think critically and collaboratively about how to solve complex customer problems. Over time, you will have the opportunity to help shape and grow not just the product, but also the team.          The Senior Product Manager role has an area of ownership within the product portfolio, and works with a feature crew of engineers and designers to identify, define, validate, and ship features.               Responsibilities         You will work with customers and stakeholders to define a roadmap, problems and requirements, and backlog, then manage them through the product development process from discovery to general availability.     You will become an expert on our software, customer, and our market, as well as be able to identify, prioritise and execute on both tactical and strategic projects.     You work well cross-functionally with other teams such as executives, product marketing, customer success and make sure their objectives are met, opinions are considered, and plans communicated.     You will work with your partner teams in design and engineering, both within your region as well as globally, to ensure that we ship a high quality product, on time, that provides a great experience to our users.     You will collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders and other teams to shape requirements, features and end products.     You will dig deep into customer and usage data to identify opportunities and evaluate the success of our effort           Required Qualifications         This is a senior-level position. You have been building software products for some time and have 5+ years of experience shipping products as a PM in an agile / scrum / kanban environment.     You are experienced at taking ideas and ambiguous data, defining the right outcome, and then mapping the right roadmap/backlog to get there.     You are able to consider and balance the many different data points and opinions about your area of ownership.     You can communicate and articulate the strategy and roadmap to execs, team members and customers.     This is a technical role, you will be able to work directly with senior engineers and instinctively understand technical concepts and trade-offs.     You are able to comfortably handle many concurrent projects and to do's, and instinctively re-prioritize often without needing guidance. Highspot is in the growth/scale stage and you will be comfortable with the level of ambiguity and workload that entails.     You have the ability to roll up your sleeves and pick up work outside of your role definition when you need to.     You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to ship high-quality products.     You are a strong communicator and can lead teams through difficult decisions.     You have strong data skills in quantitative analytics and qualitative user research.
column11: Product management, User research, Product quality, Trade, Usage, Agile scrum, Product portfolio, sales enablement, Analytics, Product marketing

You will become an expert on our software, customer, and our market, as well as be able to identify, prioritize and execute on both tactical and strategic projects.     You work well cross-functionally with other teams such as executives, product marketing, customer success and make sure their objectives are met, opinions are considered, and plans communicated.     You will collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders and other teams to shape requirements, features and end products.     You will dig deep into customer and usage data to identify opportunities and evaluate the success of our efforts.     You will work closely with industry experts to understand industry direction and trends and identify opportunities for RD that can set us apart from the competition.               Your Background        This is a senior-level position. You have experience working on complex user scenarios, with multiple personas interacting through the tool.     You have experience understanding intricate systems, and partnering with Design to deliver simple, yet powerful, user experiences. Desired Qualifications        You have experience building products for sales, marketing or other customer-facing teams. column2: We are looking for a Technical Product Manager (TPM) to support the Digital and Analytics COE. The role will partner with Engineering, business counterparts  and collaborate with diverse cross-function team members to execute complex and strategic product initiatives.  The TPM will transform vision into action and create measurable product plans.  We are looking for a candidate who has experience in building innovative products in the B2B space and can oversee creation and execution of multi-year product roadmap across multiple parallel workstreams in collaboration with engineering, business, program, and operations teams. ? WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON : * Lead the creation of an end to end product/platform vision and multi-year roadmap for a function in partnership with Engineering teams and the business * Partner with all stakeholders to understand Business needs, outcomes and value and ensure roadmaps are aligned to those needs * Ensure roadmaps account for and integrate dependencies across functional areas within Domains * Ensuring Tech Team roadmaps account for and integrate dependencies across functional areas within Domains * Collaborating with other TPM's, Domain TPM's other leaders to address dependencies across Global Tech; provide inputs into overall end to end Tech roadmap development * Partnering with all stakeholders to understand business needs and goals and providing strategic advice on how to respond * Utilizing a "customer-centric" mindset in designing roadmaps and building products/platforms that both meet current and future enterprise needs * Developing product and platform strategies to ensure they deliver value Globally * Bringing best-in-class market and industry insights to platform and product strategy * Use a value framework to make product and platform decisions * Drive the execution steps of product management in accordance with the value framework * Track value delivered, product adoption, performance, and execution against the end to end roadmap and adjusting roadmaps as necessary * Ensure TPM maturity throughout all levels of the Tech Team, including support for the discipline (e.g., role development, career pathing) ? WHAT YOU BRING: You will be skilled in product management and analytics, a structured and data-driven thinker, and have excellent interpersonal skills. Experience designing creative, quality technical products and enabling business capabilities and objectives through technology will be critical. You should be comfortable conducting user research, usability testing, A/B testing, and rapid prototyping. You should be a skilled communicator with experience forming alliances and bringing together multiple stakeholders to execute on a common mission. You should have at least 7-10 years of experience in product management in a technology-centric business and clearly demonstrated these skills: * Strong Analytical and Data Visualization Skills * Great business acumen and communication skills * Excellent analysis and problem-solving skills * Strong meeting and work session facilitation skills * Strong project planning and organizational skills * Experience in Agile methodology * Experience working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment * Validated ability to adapt to new technologies and tools, changing needs, processes, and ambiguity * Strong understanding of Design Thinking Concepts and Design Leadership * Strong understanding of Value-Driven Frameworks * Strong understanding of enterprise-level platforms and technologies  ? ADDITIONAL PREFERENCES ARE: * Product Management experience conducting strategic quantitative and/or qualitative analysis in a cross-functional enterprise environment in the tech industry to improve business operations involving program, process, or product management * Managing day to day project communications and contributing to Sr. executive management reports and business presentations * Product Management, strategic management consulting, financial analysis, sales/business development, technology, and P&L management * Writing both long and short-term product planning reports, including strategic market analysis, product placement, and financial/business reporting

Once envisioned, they inspire and align stakeholders - business, operations and finance, and through engineers transform their vision into reality. column1: Senior Product Manager - Open Platform Initiative
column2: We are seeking aSenior Product Manager to spearhead a new initiative called Open Platformthat will enable strategic content partners to use the GenieAI platform.          Wewill provide these partners with technical features and support so that theycan serve their courses from within the GenieAI platform, which will enabletheir course learners can take full advantage of our GenAI Copilots (My Tutorfor learners and My Mentor for faculty) and our human services (such as forums,expert connects, streaming masterclasses, and help desk).        Our initial focusgeographies for Open Platform strategic partnerships are India, Brazil, andMexico, with additional countries to be added in the future.        This Open Platforminitiative has already garnered significant interest from government,corporate, and NGO partners, and we are looking for a product leader who willbe responsible for driving and sustaining the initiative with the objective ofaccelerating learner outcomes at scale.            Key Responsibilities                     Conduct Need and Opportunity Analysis    : Analyze partner needs and strategicopportunities in order to inform our market requirements definition.                Develop Product and ProcessRequirements    : Createproduct requirements definitions and supplementary process documentation thatenable the seamless ingestion of partner content and the configuration ofeffective Gen AI Copilots and human services around that content.                Drive Product Launch    : Work with other team members fromProduct, Design, and Engineering to develop and release product features forstrategic content partners, learners, and faculty. Subsequently, test thosefeatures in Beta with strategic content partners and with learners and facultyfrom educational partner institutions, and refine those features as neededbefore production launch.                Serve as SPOC with Strategic Partners    : Serve as single point of contactwith strategic content partners to ensure that their needs are met and thatthey are motivated to continue and deepen their engagement with the OpenPlatform.                Drive Product Enhancement Based onMarket Data    : Seek userfeedback and identify enhancements for subsequent build cycles on regular basisbased on feedback from strategic content partners, educational partners,learners, and faculty.            Skills & Experience                      6+ years of work experience, with atleast 3 years experience in EdTech Product Management required (experience inonline adult skills training preferred)                Proven success in developing andexecuting on strategic product intiatives within the EdTech ecosystem                Strong relationship and oralcommunication skills, including the ability to engage effectively withexecutive leadership and strategic partners                Demonstrated product managementsuccess across the mobile web & app product lifecycle from concept tolaunch and adoption.          Conducting market research        Defining user roles, user journeys, and product requirements        Working with UX designers in mocking wireframes and visuals for mobile and web        Collaborating closely with engineering in defining requirements, prioritization, and sprint planning        Discussing tech architecture, design, and scoping with engineering        Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills        Abilityto thrive in a fast paced, startup environment with tight deadlines.

column2: health responsibilitiesThe defaultJob description Responsibilities: Lead the planning and execution of the product roadmap, aligning with the overall business objectives. Define and prioritize product features based on customer feedback, data analysis, marketing demands and domain requirements. Drive the product development process, from ideation through release, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality outcomes. Collaborate closely with engineering, marketing, and sales, to drive successful launch, development, and advancement of B2B products. Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including customers, to gather insights and ensure product satisfaction. Provide clear and concise communication of product vision, goals, and progress to both internal teams and external stakeholders. Conduct market research to identify trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape, informing product strategy and decision-making. Monitor product performance through metrics, iterating on the product strategy as needed to achieve business objectives. Mentor junior product managers in terms of general learning and product/feature-specific guidance Be responsible for feature validation, both in terms of quality and user satisfaction. Requirements: 5-8 years of relevant experience in software product management. At least 3 years of complex B2B software product management experience. Analytical mindset with a willingness to go deep into problem-solving. Being data-driven is essential; inclined to use data to validate assumptions and business assertions. Strong technical understanding of the software development process and general design constructs. Impeccable collaboration and communication skills. Bias for action: Default setting is to take action to move the product forward and improve customer experience. Empathetic: Can deeply embed in the customer perspective and translate their needs to crisp, detailed, and actionable product requirements Thrives in a complex, ambiguous, and fast-paced environment, driving agile experimentation Understanding of the US healthcarresponsibilitiese industry is a big plus. Prior start-up experience is a plus

column2: As a senior product manager, you will research, define a roadmap, design products, collaborate with the engineering team to develop and deliver the new products.            Duties and Responsibilities                  Use primary and secondary research, discuss with customers, sales and marketing teams to generate ideas for products to develop.          Define a roadmap and refine with feedback from leadership and team members. Define priorities, identify requirements and develop designs.          Write clear and detailed specifications (why and what), persuade others and collaborate with engineering and marketing teams to build and deliver the product.          Define product marketing communications, demonstrations and user experience training content to assist in positioning and pre-sales. You will possess deep customer empathy and passion for solving problems.          As a senior product owner, you will also understand the competitive landscape, analyze and position the product better. You will assist leadership and deliver analyses, reports, presentation and product marketing engagements.          You will operate nimbly and work closely with the product as the first user to ensure user experience is at higher standards. Define KPIs and measure product success, learn from customer support and tune as needed.          Continuously look for ways to do the work better and help others in the organization.                 Required Qualifications                  Product management or Analyst experience in a cross-functional fast growing environment, working closely with technical teams, including software development, engineering and testing to create and launch software products.          3 years Hands on experience in writing user stories, refining product backlogs and coordinating/prioritizing conflicting requirements.          3 years Ability to thoroughly understand complex business and technical issues and influence decision making.          4 years Well versed in agile methodologies and tools.          4 years Consistent use of verbal and written communication skills to influence outcomes.             Ability to balance multiple priorities, drive incremental delivery and meet deadlines.          Prior programming experience, especially with enterprise mobile and web apps is a plus.          Prior experience with data driven insights, AI, ML and NLP technologies is a plus.          Prior experience in B2B software focused on HR, sales and training areas is a plus.         Bachelors or Masters degree in management and engineering is preferred.

Collaborate with other product managers, engineering staff and other stakeholders to build product features      Conduct user study to enhance workflow improvement      Track user, industry trends, standards and competitive offerings in the markets, as prioritized by senior management.
