column2: In this role, you will be joining the Product Management team reporting to the Director of Product Management. The Product Management function at Highspot is an integral part of the company. You will be jumping into many different projects and features, and will be very hands-on. You will be working very closely with design, user research and engineering to think critically and collaboratively about how to solve complex customer problems. Over time, you will have the opportunity to help shape and grow not just the product, but also the team.          The Senior Product Manager role has an area of ownership within the product portfolio, and works with a feature crew of engineers and designers to identify, define, validate, and ship features.         What Youll Do         You will work with customers and stakeholders to define a roadmap, problems and requirements, and backlog, then manage them through the product development process from discovery to general availability.      You will become an expert on our software, customer, and our market, as well as be able to identify, prioritize and execute on both tactical and strategic projects.      You work well cross-functionally with other teams such as executives, product marketing, customer success and make sure their objectives are met, opinions are considered, and plans communicated.     You will work with your partner teams in design and engineering, both within your region as well as globally, to ensure that we ship a high quality product, on time, that provides a great experience to our users.     You will collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders and other teams to shape requirements, features and end products.     You will dig deep into customer and usage data to identify opportunities and evaluate the success of our efforts.                 Your Background         This is a senior-level position. You have been building software products for some time and have 5+ years of experience shipping products as a PM in an agile / scrum / kanban environment.      You are experienced at taking ideas and ambiguous data, defining the right outcome, and then mapping the right roadmap/backlog to get there.     You are able to consider and balance the many different data points and opinions about your area of ownership.     You can communicate and articulate the strategy and roadmap to execs, team members and customers.     This is a technical role, you will be able to work directly with senior engineers and instinctively understand technical concepts and trade-offs.     You are able to comfortably handle many concurrent projects and to dos, and instinctively re-prioritize often without needing guidance. Highspot is in the growth/scale stage and you will be comfortable with the level of ambiguity and workload that entails.     You have the ability to roll up your sleeves and pick up work outside of your role definition when you need to.      You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to ship high-quality products.     You are a strong communicator and can lead teams through difficult decisions.     You have strong data skills in quantitative analytics and qualitative user research.                 Desired Qualifications         You have experience building mobile     You have experience managing products for sales, marketing or other customer-facing teams.     You have experience in consumer or B2B SaaS and understand the mechanics and economics of a SaaS business.     You have a technical degree or equivalent work experience.

column2: Primary Responsibility:               Product Manager will lead the development, release, and iteration of Reventics products to meet market and client needs. The Product Manager works both with internal and client business leaders to identify and define product needs, with engineering team to develop, enhance and deliver the products.       Job Duties:         Manage end-to-end product development activities including research, exploration, design, development/refinement and client delivery for Reventics products.         Be clinically savvy and oversee the development and execution of clinical algorithms, and reporting tools that answer applied research and business questions for diverse provider clients.         Key responsibilities would include: General product management - defining market requirements, product roadmaps, and packaging the features into product releases for the assigned product capabilities.         Work with various clinical and operational groups across the organization to review existing processes, facilitate the gathering of requirements and influence the future direction of Reventics products to improve customer satisfaction, operational efficiency, and optimize product performance.         Provide product leadership and expertise to drive the development activities within the technology engineering organization and handle cross-functional interaction with clinical, IT and operations groups within Reventics.         Analyze the competitive landscape and client requests for market needs that current products and capabilities do not meet; define user personas, write product requirements and use scenario, and create/maintain prioritized product backlogs.         Work with engineering to conduct technology assessments and ensure that technical designs are aligned with industry trends and evolving market needs.         Monitor product releases to ensure high quality and on-time delivery, and coordinate launch activities to drive commercial success.         Create functional specifications, detailed storyboards, wireframes and other prototypes for a clear and comprehensive depiction of the product offering; Document business process flows and perform research as required to support internal and client requests.         Build strong working relationships across Reventics to determine future product direction and assist in the successful design and launch of new capabilities.         Demonstrate strong project leadership and communication skills and serve as a subject matter expert on products and processes within the scope of responsibilities.         Have firm grounding in US healthcare and healthcare technology data standards like HL7 etc. Define business case for new or enhanced product capabilities to ensure the proposed capabilities are aligned with the strategic business goals.         Qualifications   :               Bachelors degree in healthcare, business, engineering or related area is required. MBA is preferred.     Prior product management experience in working US healthcare focused product.     Effective communication and negotiation skills.         Product Manager Characteristics         Outcome-oriented analytical thinking - can interpret data and draw meaningful conclusions that benefit constituents and drive decisions.         Problem solving - can leverage creative thinking/innovation to drive solutions through logical, well-structured thought processes.         Root-cause analysis - experienced and can identify, understand, and communicate drivers in analyses.         Product lifecycle management - responsible for the design, development, and management of new and existing product capabilities.         Extremely strong communication and relationship management skills; uses appropriate communication vehicles; understands audience and uses the best method of conveying a message; can negotiate with and influence other leaders.         Self-starter with a can-do attitude, willing to demonstrate initiative along with the ability to work as a team player. Develops innovative approaches. Sought out as expert.         Ability to set priorities and work on multiple tasks simultaneously; Excellent attention to detail, accuracy and follow up.

Roles & Responsibilities ??You will be responsible for New Products conceptualization and planning by gathering feedback on unmet therapeutic needs, identifying new product opportunities, and presenting business cases to the vertical head and country head for timely product selection, aligning with long and short-term objectives. ??You will be responsible for New Products Launch Planning by preparing product manuals, designing positioning strategies, and overseeing successful product launches through effective communication and collaboration with regional sales teams. ??You will be responsible for Post-Launch Audit of New Products by coordinating with sales teams, reviewing performance, and initiating corrective actions when necessary to ensure new products meet or exceed sales projections. ??You will be responsible for Branding and Promotions by conducting market research, finalizing positioning strategies, and overseeing effective promotion strategies by collaborating with ad agencies and implementing marketing plans in alignment with business goals. ??You will be responsible for Continuing Medical Education (CME) Programs by identifying CME needs, inviting speakers and doctors, and ensuring successful execution of CME programs to establish lasting relationships with healthcare professionals. ??You will be responsible for leading and developing the team by conducting performance appraisals, mentoring team members, and collaborating with HR for recruitment and talent development to maximize team performance and retention. ??You will be responsible for sales planning and review by gathering feedback from regional sales manager (RSMs), devising region-specific strategies, and incorporating regional needs into the product plan to enhance overall performance.   Qualification Educational qualification -A graduate degree in any Science stream Minimum work experience - 7-10 years of experience in Product Management in pharmaceutical Skills & attributes Technical Skills  ??Understanding of Indian Pharmaceutical industry- competition, customer behaviour and prescription habits. ??Strategic mindset to develop and implement long-term product strategies that align with the company's overall business objectives. ??Analytical skills to assess market trends, competitor activities, and customer needs for the products in the portfolio. ??Financial management skills to develop and manage budgets, allocate resources effectively, and optimize cost control for the product portfolio. ??Excellent communication skills to convey complex scientific and medical information to diverse audiences, including healthcare professionals, internal teams, and stakeholders. ??Ability to analyze market data, clinical trial results, and sales performance to inform decision-making and product portfolio strategies. ??Ability to adapt to changes in the pharmaceutical market, including advancements in therapies, healthcare policies, and regulatory updates. Behavioural Skills : ??Proactive and visionary mind-set ??Strong networking skills ??Effective people management abilities ??Adaptability and change management skills ??Strategic orientation and decision-making capabilities   Additional Information About the Department Global Generics India Global Generics India business journey began in 1986. In the last three decades, we have grown as a trusted name in the healthcare industry and rank as one of the top 10 Pharma Companies in the Indian Pharma Market (IPM) as per IQVIA MAT (November 2022). Our commitment to Lead Ahead has helped us move ranks from 16th position to 10th position (IPM) in the last four years. We are a fast-growing organisation with double-digit growth and significant market share in domestic markets. Currently, we rank among the top 5 in oncology, anti-allergy and gastrointestinal diseases and the top 10 in a few other therapy areas. Our focus is on leveraging our digital capabilities, collaborations, innovations and inorganic opportunities to become the top 5 companies in the Indian Pharma Market. Benefits Offered At Dr. Reddy?? we actively help to catalyse your career growth and professional development through personalised learning programs. The benefits you will enjoy at Dr. Reddy?? are on par with the best industry standards. They include, among other things and other essential equipment, joining & relocation support, family support (Maternity & Paternity benefits), learning and development opportunities, medical coverage for yourself and your family, life coverage for yourself. Our Work Culture Ask any employee at Dr. Reddy?? why they come to work every day and they??l say, because Good Health Can?? Wait. This is our credo as well as the guiding principle behind all our actions. We see healthcare solutions not only as scientific formulations, but as a means to help patients lead healthier lives, and we??e always attuned to the new and the next to empower people to stay fit. And to do this, we foster a culture of empathy and dynamism. People are at the core of our journey over the last few decades. They have been supported by an enabling environment that buoys individual ability while fostering teamwork and shared success. We believe that when people with diverse skills are bound together by a common purpose and value system, they can make magic. For more details, please visit our career website at  https://careers.drreddys.com/#!/?

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities IBM Data & AI organization is looking for highly skilled and experienced product managers to drive the growth of our portfolio. An ideal candidate would be an entrepreneurial, adaptable, analytical, persuasive, empathetic, tenacious, and creative problem solver, who is well versed in both business and technology concepts. We are specifically looking for candidates with substantial exposure to various data and AI products and services and successful track records of leading workstreams and smaller teams. Technical expertise is critical to be successful in this role. Responsibilities: Product Managers (PM) operate in a demanding role at the epicenter of multi-disciplinary teams which include design, engineering, sales, marketing, finance, and legal. In this role, you,ll play a central role leading and orchestrating the definition of product requirements and go-to-market strategy to solve data challenges of enterprise and mid-market clients. This role requires collaboration and coordination across internal and external teams and will be visible at the highest levels of our organization. You,ll work with Data and AI experts, partners, and other cross functional stakeholders to prioritize roadmap features and spearhead the definition and delivery of new and differentiated capabilities. Innovate with established and emerging technology software, hardware, and services Act as change agents and champion strategic initiatives and partnerships Work collaboratively with development leaders, product architects, product designers, and key clients to appropriately package features into offering releases and ensure offering designs reflect business objectives Establish goals and review metrics to plan and deliver success and drive business review on a regular cadence Regularly participate in overall functional program planning Articulate market problems to the broader product team Develop and execute roadmaps, business models, and go-to-market plans Drive client validation through beta programs and client meetings, confirming requirements are addressed by the delivered solution Collaborate closely with design and engineering to ship offerings Work with clients, offering management, and sales leadership around the world to understand and track the health and adoption of services and gather feedback Support press and analyst activities as required Required Technical and Professional Expertise The successful candidate must have exceptional technical capabilities, communication skills, strong business judgment, and demonstrated relevant experience with Data and AI products and/or services. We are looking for a proven ability to execute both strategically and tactically, and someone who is excited to take on new, ambitious projects that will be industry defining and trend setting. This position requires a strong business and technical background, and the candidate should be client-focused with a passion for delivering compelling user experiences. When considering applicants for this role, we look for education and background in areas such as innovation, entrepreneurship, engineering, computer science, market/user research, design thinking, technology commercialization, business, and go-to-market practices. We look for candidates who exhibit the aptitude and experience relevant to product management. Minimum 5 years of either Product Management or Project Development experience, with responsibility for researching, developing, and managing the lifecycle of offerings Deep technical expertise and knowledge of Agile Software Development Processes Demonstrated business leadership and technical acumen to drive a diverse offering portfolio in a cross-functional environment Self-starter with proven record to deliver client and business outcomes Conduct primary and secondary research regarding your service areas with prospects and clients, keeping a regular pulse on the market needs Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams to achieve aggressive business objectives Proven ability to synthesize complex issues and opinions into simple stories Attention to details, ability to analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, and scope business requirements Ability to deliver initiatives from conception through completion in an iterative way Ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to influence others internally and externally Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise 10 years of either Product Management or Project Development experience, with responsibility for researching, developing, and managing the lifecycle of offerings Substantial exposure to Cloud technologies, Enterprise Platforms, Open source, Data science, and Database management technologies Experience using tools such as Aha!, Jira, Github, and Mural Experience with Design thinking, and building highly engaging and intuitive software Proven ability to develop and execute new ideas and creative solutions

column2: As the    Product Manager    for Platform Services, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and      executing the product strategy for essential components of our healthcare technology      platform. You will be responsible for overseeing the development and enhancement of      platform services, including metadata management, access control, user management,      and authentication policies.      If you are a strategic thinker, a collaborative leader, and passionate about driving      innovation in healthcare technology, we invite you to join our team and contribute to the      future of healthcare.                  A Day in the Life         Product Strategy and Roadmap:           Develop a comprehensive understanding of market trends, customer      needs, and competitive landscape to inform the platform services      roadmap.         Contribute to and execute on a product strategy that aligns with the      companys overall vision and goals.           Cross-functional Collaboration:           Collaborate closely with engineering, design, and other cross-functional      teams to translate product strategy into actionable plans and deliverables.         Work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure the      platform services meet the needs of internal and external users.           Platform Services Development:           Oversee the end-to-end product development lifecycle for platform      services, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality features.         Prioritize and manage the product backlog, balancing business priorities      and technical constraints.           User Experience and Design:           Champion user-centric design principles to ensure platform services are      intuitive, efficient, and provide an exceptional user experience.         Work closely with UX/UI teams to create user interface designs that      enhance usability and accessibility.           Performance and Metrics:           Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for platform services and      regularly analyze and report on the performance metrics.         Utilize data-driven insights to make informed decisions and continuously      optimize the platform services.           Compliance and Security:           Ensure platform services comply with industry regulations and standards,      particularly in the healthcare sector.         Collaborate with the security and compliance teams to implement robust      access controls and authentication policies.           What You Need           Bachelor s degree in a relevant field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.         Proven experience as a Product Manager, preferably in healthcare technology or      SaaS.         Strong understanding of platform services, including metadata management,     access control, user management, and authentication policies.         Exceptional leadership and communication skills with the ability to influence and      collaborate effectively at all levels of the organization.         Experience working in an agile development environment.         Familiarity with healthcare industry regulations and standards, such as HL7 FHIR.         Familiarity with auth tools such as OAuth2 and experience using auth services      such as Okta, and cloud IAM vendors.

Principal?Product Manager Locations:  Pune, Bangalore, Ahmedabad Reports to:  VP, Product Management   A quick snapshot The Principal Product Manager at Conga is responsible for the product direction, planning, execution, and launch of product releases. Conga thrives in solving our customers business problems and creating raving fans in the process. Here you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design products that our customers and their customers love! Join the team at Conga to help drive the next phase of growth.   Why it?? a big deal A Conga Principal Product Manager is continuously adapting & is excited to work on Products, cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. ?You have a technical passion to break down complex problems into steps that drive the product development lifecycle including analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting & tailoring our solutions to meet our customer needs.   Are you the person we??e looking for??   Relevant Experience. ? You should have 8+ years of overall experience and a minimum of 3 years in building B2B SAS products from concept to post-launch, API, and integrations & familiarity with building ML based products. Ability and confidence to work closely with select customers in pre-sales and collaborative scenarios. Experience with integrated solutions for major platforms such as Microsoft, SAP, Oracle, or Salesforce is strongly desired. You??l be involved in technical publications, providing guidance to product education teams for technical and product documentation, and transitioning finished projects to the Customer-facing teams.   Research and Creativity.  Own the research, action plans, adoption plans, and results for the products. Map business ideas and use cases into product requirements and roadmap, set goals, determine priorities, and track deliverables. You will create solutions to problems with our products while always focusing on the best user experience and balancing company goals, product cohesion, and ease of implementation, research, wireframing, and incorporating user feedback into the product. Leadership skills.  Work across multiple teams to deliver quality software at a consistent pace, which aligns to the product vision. Guide the scrum teams to deliver great software at an impressive pace. Keep the team aligned with the work at hand and the completion of the greater feature, gather product requirements from stakeholders, manage release status for development and communicate status to other departments in the company. Work closely with the development team to decompose high-level features into user stories, quickly provide just-in-time decisions to system-level questions, and defect triage. Analyze and prioritize.  Schedule development work for releases. Work with product management and development teams to create and maintain product priorities, track schedules against delivery commitments, and escalate risks and issues. Work with and maintain communication with stakeholders. Analyze product metrics to understand product performance. Customer experience.  Aligning customer experience strategies with marketing initiatives and informing customers about new product features and functionalities. Analyzing customer feedback on product ranges and new releases and preparing reports accordingly. Documenting processes and logging technical issues, as well as customer compliments and complaints. Here?? what will give you an edge Champion the Customer . You understand that customers are one of the business?? most important assets and you take that seriously. With more than 11,000 customers around the globe entrusting Conga with their business we make a commitment to their success and would love to hear how you will too!?? Natural collaborator. You work effectively with Product Manager, are proficient with Agile and a collaborative cross-functional approach to building awesome software. You are comfortable working with teams and collaborating on best practices across multiple Agile teams. You constantly seek opinions and solicit feedback to create the best work possible. You don?? know any other way. It?? a team effort and you completely appreciate that.? Passion. We know it when we see it. Passion is not about saying how much you love what you do in your most excited voice. Passion is revealed in your truest self. It?? about what you??e accomplished; how you want to grow; the ideas you have; your philosophies. It?? demonstrating through your words and your actions that you truly believe in what you do -- and where you work. That it matters to you. And that?? pretty cool.? Did we pique your interest?   If this sounds like the kind of job you would love in the kind of environment where you would thrive, please click apply. We'd love to hear from you!?

column2: Senior Manager - Product Manager - Digital Products (Capital Markets)  Ventura is an omnichannel trading and investment platform with a network of branches, sub-brokers and Digital Channels. Founded in 1994, the company is now entering the next phase of growth by pivoting to a digital-first approach and strengthening its direct-to-consumer franchise. The company has now carved out a separate fintech vertical tasked with digital transformation using cutting-edge technology and bringing in fresh talent.  The organisation is seeking a team of Product Managers to help lead a flagship project through innovative digital products across the investment spectrum. column2: THE ROLE : You will be directly responsible for managing technical requirements on a multi-platform solution, driving technology decisions based on analytics, and ensuring on-time and accurate delivery of technical enhancements. This includes activities such as : - Eliciting requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, business analysis, competitive product analysis, and/or task and workflow analysis - Conducting usability labs and developing other student-centered methods to optimize user interactions that improve the overall customer experience and drive business outcomes - Working with the business unit owners to define and document the solution's vision and scope - Working with engineering team to develop functional requirement documents - Breaking down high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements, specified in an appropriate level of technical detail suitable for use by engineering team - Leading requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, and verifiable - Using research and analysis to identify emerging approaches, technology, and solutions that can be leveraged in the implementation of identified requirements - Working with engineering team to create estimates to determine duration and level of complexity for functional scope items THE QUALIFICATIONS : - Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other related fields - 3-5 years of relevant work experience in Financial Services (consumer credit, education financing, or online lending platforms), with a background in consulting a plus - Experience performing current and future state analysis for IT systems - 1-2 years of consumer-focused product design and usability experience highly desirable - Ability to interview and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information Advanced analytical skills : - Evaluate the information gathered, reconcile conflicts - Decompose high-level information into details - Distinguish presented business requests from the underlying true needs - Distinguish solutions from requirements - Strong communication skills, to relay information effectively to business unit owners, engineering team, and executive management - Ability to create documentation that is leveled for both business and technical users - A demonstrated working knowledge of agile software development - Demonstrated experience working with PHP LAMP, Salesforce, and Google Cloud, and Amazon Cloud infrastructure - A passion for financial inclusion and access to higher education is a must!
column11: Business Analysis, Product Management, Amazon Cloud infrastructure, PHP LAMP, Salesforce, Google Cloud

column2: Leading the product lifecycle from ideation through technical development to launch, including defining product roadmap, setting milestones, driving deliverables, and considering stakeholder feedback     Collaborating with different cross-functional teams to align product vision, ensuring the product meets both user needs and business goals     Establishing, monitoring, and measuring product success using various key technical metrics and analytics     Identifying, documenting, and communicating technical product requirements and specifications to the engineering department     Responding promptly to any technical issues encountered after product launch and working towards their resolution     Managing stakeholder communication effectively, keeping them updated about progress, seeking necessary approvals, and addressing queries in a timely and concise manner     Ensuring the alignment of product developments with Mercari crossborder mission, goals, and objectives     Prioritizing product feature backlog to ensure focus on delivering maximum business value is maintained     Defininge and prioritizingprioritize product features based on business goals and customer needs, design APIs, dashboards, deliver PRD API documentation.       Ensuring compliance with all legal, regulatory and organisational standards and requirements.     Unique and Bold Challenges        Our team is currently looking for a product manager who has a passion to build global product for worldwide customers. In this role, it is critical to have a customer mindset in this role as you need to simplifying the oversea buyers and seller experience, and make the shopping experience fun. You will focus on enabling crossborder functions around item discovery, purchase including payment and shipping options. You will own the end to end new initiative planning from vision and strategy setting, business impact estimation to delivery. And you will also get opportunity to collaborate across business dev, business analytics, product, design and engineering to build solutions to expand Mercari crossborder business.     During the product development, you will identify key risks, dependencies, and work with the requisite teams to put solutions in place that will achieve the product outcomes. You will also need to have analytical mindset to leverage data and insights from our customers and inventing new ideas to help business growth and delight customer experience.         Required Qualifications        Shared belief in the mission and values of Mercari Group and its various companies     7 years+ technical product management experience     5 years+ experience working with complex system architecture/integration and api design     A BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent     Ability to propose, plan and execute product strategies      Strong communication and collaboration skills to drive cross-functional teams      Strong problem solving skills to identify risks/dependencies, prioritize problems effectively, proposeexecute solution and adapting to changing priorities.     Experienced in data-driven approach on decision-making         Preferred Qualifications         Deep understanding and experienced in either Web platform, Mobile app platform or API product.      Experienced in multi-language/multi-region product for worldwide customers      Knowledge of C2C and/or B2C commerce systems     Experience launching or growing a web/app service for new business      Experience in planning and management for middle or bigger projects

column2: Summary Product Manager who is passionate about building products that customers love. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the companys vision and strategy. As a product manager on our dynamic and driven team, you will be responsible for owning the development and delivery of new features and enhancements in our SaaS product. Develops products by identifying potential products; conducting market research; generating product requirements; determining specifications, production timetables, pricing, and time-integrated plans for product introduction, developing marketing strategies. Responsibilities Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth. Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners. Work with Product Owners and Engineering team to Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes. Scope and prioritize features and releases based on business and customer impact. Work closely with engineering teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources. Drive product Releases including working with Front end teams  Customer success, Sales team, executives, and other product management team members. Evaluate promotional plans to ensure that they are consistent with product line strategy and that the message is effectively conveyed. Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding. Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services. Drives the product and is responsible for the feature releases are in the product both on Mobile and Web Platforms. Determine customers' needs and desires by specifying the research needed to obtain market information. Recommend the nature and scope of present and future product lines by reviewing product specifications and requirements, appraising new product ideas and/or product or packaging changes. Assess market competition by comparing the company's product to competitors' products. Obtain feedback from customers/Customer Success teams and enhance product. Have clear short term and long-term roadmap of the overall product. Brings new products to market by analysing proposed product requirements and product development programs, preparing effort estimates, establishing time schedules with engineering. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Essential Skills Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle in BI & Analytics space. Experience working with Generative AI technologies such as GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) models is highly desirable. Expertise in any of the leading BI & Analytics tools ??Tableau, Qlikview, Sisense, Power BI or similar. Expertise in Data Engineering, Data modelling, Data / Text Analytics, Data visualization, Data connectors.  Sound knowledge or experience in Machine learning, Deep Learning, Python, or any of the ML products  Proven ability to develop product and marketing strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management. Expertise in Product Management, Product Development, Requirements Analysis, Planning, Competitive Analysis and Strategy in BI & Analytics space Expertise in SDLC, Agile Scrum methodology in product development & product support. Expert in creating User Stories in Task management tools like Jira. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Passionate about building class products on both web and mobile. Strong leader, self-starter and proven team player in a high achievement-oriented environment Excellent relationship skills, ability to establish credibility and rapport with technical and non-technical team members and to work collaboratively and cross-functionally. Good understanding of developing Performance Management/HRMS products and technologies. Must be tech-savvy with the ability to understand technology capabilities and processes. Ability to juggle multiple priorities and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Team player     Competencies Strategy Development Team Management Technical Competence Leadership skills Educational Qualification and Experience Required MS/ME/BS/BE degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent preferred. MBA Graduate Minimum 6-9 years of Product Management experience

column2: As a Product Manager, you ll start your journey at Freight Tiger with what is best for our customers in the complex logistics ecosystem in India. That can be hard, but we refuse to settle, given we are a customer-obsessed company. We are committed to figuring out what matters to our customers and then doing everything in our power to deliver it.        We are looking for an experienced product manager who is passionate about solving customer problems and who has demonstrated success working backwards from ambiguous customer needs, translating them into disruptive, successful products that delight customers. In this role, you will be defining strategy/product vision through feature definition, prioritization, positioning, naming, go-to-market/adoption and PL. You will put to use best of breed technologies and design thinking to accomplish this at a scale that has never been done before in the logistics industry.      Key responsibilities:      Own the entire product life cycle for products at Freight Tiger from inception, to strategic planning, delivery to live launch, post-launch tracking and ongoing product management, enhancement, and development.      Work closely with internal stakeholders across Product, Engineering, Customer Support and Sales to deeply understand and address product needs.      Work with customers and the leadership team to understand the customer s needs and define solutions in line with the business strategy.      Conceptualize new business initiatives by working with business stakeholders and creating business impact through effective planning, business analysis and operational data metrics, and by driving execution with operations and technology teams.      Create product specification documents and conduct product specification reviews with key stakeholders.      Analyze product metrics regularly and use the learning for product innovations and improvements.      Proactively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team s ability to meet strategic, financial and technical goals.      Define and track metrics that measure the success of your product/features, including adoption and growth.      Freight Commerce Solutions Pvt Ltd. (CIN: U74120MH2014PTC255210) B-201, Polaris Building, Off Marol Maroshi Road, Marol, Andheri (E), Mumbai - 400059           Hold external communications with customers to understand their needs closely.      Preferred qualifications/skills:      B.Tech / B.E. in any stream, and preferably MBA from a Tier-1 institute (but not essential) At least 3+ years of experience, preferably in a B2B startup. Passion for technology and tracking developments in the tech/logistics industry. Self-driven, comfortable with a fast-paced, always-on, highly ambiguous environment. Strong influence and cross-functional collaboration skills; able to craft clarity and drive focus in complex and dynamic contexts. High problem solving and customer-centric mindset.      Strong passion for data-driven decision making i.e. extremely high focus on analytics. You are technically tuned and business savvy to interface with all levels and disciplines      within an organization, from engineers to senior leadership. To be able to communicate both the business and technical rationale behind your product decisions. Product user experience understanding and understanding of mobile is a plus. Strong communication skills, skilled at cross-functional and cross-organizational      communication. Must be able to work independently and enjoy working in a fast-paced start-up

column2: THE IDEAL CANDIDATE       The ideal candidate is a self-starter, problem-solver and successful in combining technology and data into best-in-class outcomes. The candidate is energized by solving complex business problems and consistently effective in making high-judgement decisions at rapid pace amidst the frequent ambiguity that comes with charting a course of action with no precedent. initiatives with the objective of ensuring the highest customer value     Work closely with Product Managers and Business teams to optimize the ad spend for maximum reach and return on ad spend (ROAS)     Own the Customer data for Quince and enable insights using the Customer data               What youll need        A bachelors degree in Computer Science with 8+ years of experience     Experience of working in highly dynamic Engineering environment like a start-up     Deep understanding in one of Object-Oriented programming languages     Strong technology acumen, knowledge of software engineering process, design knowledge and architecture intelligence     Exposure to any of the prominent cloud service providers (AWS/Azure/GCP)     Exceptional verbal and written communications skills     Attention to detail and quality, and the ability to work well in and across teams     Experience and knowledge of delivering products with low/no-touch support along with SRE principles     Prior experience in solving use cases in AdTech/Performance Marketing Engineering is highly desirable                     3-6-12 month goals            3 month goals     -Understand the current Growth hiring roadmap for the Marketing Engineering team     -Create a 1 year engineering roadmap to scale the current marketing solutions           6 month goals     -Understand the current Retention related business requirements and solution implementation     -Understand our current Retention KPIs and influence the following goals from engineering standpoint by partnering with Retention Business and PM     -Increase email phone subscription by 200%     -Reduce unsubscription rate by 20%     --Partner with DE team and own all marketing WBR reporting delivery (Growth and Retention) You know from the bottom of your heart that a PRD that speaks out the user s needs and wants is the best way to ensure internal buy-in and super high productivity levels     5. A simple annotated wireframe is much better than a 5 page PRD     6. A PRD that is more than 5 pages will not be read     7. A feature no matter how great it sounds, is a true success only when it can be measured     8. Not all your features will be a runaway success and will need constant fine-tuning on an iterative basis     9. In spirit, you are the CEO of your product         Job requirements          Person s Specifications:       1. Passionate about building products in the internet and mobile space, demonstrated either through your last job or outside of work as a hobby or part time activity     2. Strong sense of usability and information architecture     3. Exceptionally motivated about making a measurable impact on the end user     4. Experience in building products in the consumer internet or mobile space.       Competencies: -       Entrepreneurial thinking mindset: Self motivated and self-directed with an ability to think innovatively.     People Management: Ability to lead, manage & develop large teams in a fast paced environment     Passion for Results: High degree of commitment with bias for execution excellence     Customer Focus: Ability to design processes, systems & create an environment for enabling customer delight.     Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem- solving abilities

column2: SkyPoint is looking for an ambitious, independent Technical Product Manager who wants to have a big impact at a fast-growing company. We are looking for people who can understand the key values that make our product great and implement those values in the many small decisions you make every day as a member of the product development team.                Data and technology drive the way we make decisions. We love our customers and understanding them better makes it possible to provide the best products and solutions. We are seeking to add a Technical Product Manager to our fast-growing team to lead the design, development, and launch of our data and analytics platform.                         Engineer at heart:     We want leaders who like to be in the thick of things, brainstorming about architecture, technology, researching solutions, etc. Be an architect in the room.                 Coach, not a taskmaster:     Understand the strengths and weaknesses of each team member and provide opportunities for your team to learn and grow.                 Continuous improvement:     Learn through experimentation and experience, be it product, people, or platform systems.                 Product Mindset:     Understand user behavior and provide insights that can help improve products. Help to brainstorm to bring focus and therefore create impactful OKRs for your team.                  What you do:         The Technical Product Manager will oversee all aspects of product life cycle management, including understanding market demands, technology trends, and the competitive field for customer data and data privacy. We are building a culture of product excellence and execution. In this role, you will also serve as the Product Owner. Great teammates will:                         Be customer and user obsessed.     We are passionate about delivering value to our customers and users. This means listening to our market, customers, users, and teammates to understand problems and develop solutions to delight them.                 Be scrappy and nail the basics.     This means we adapt to change, sweat the details, and find a way to yes . We do what we say we are going to do and measure success.                 Consider Product is a Team Sport.     We are comprised of a diverse group of people by design. We challenge each other and our respective teams to be better every day. We value each other s insights. Delivering value to our customers and users is a team sport - one in which anyone can play.                  Skills Experience Required:                 A minimum of 4 years of experience in the similar profile in top product companies.                 Strategic thinker, Understands the vision, and the roadmap, and comes up with the approach for future release plans.                 Support the product development team by intaking enhancement ideas; bugs, and new features then, work to source and organize the information needed to execute these product changes.                 Serve as a subject matter expert regarding the configuration and usage of your products and share this expertise both internally and externally with customers.                 Maintain technical knowledge libraries for your products including integration documents, customer and market-facing documentation, system requirements, etc.                 Communicate outages, maintenance schedules, and release notes working across teams to resolve dependencies.                 Having knowledge of any Product tracking tool like Jira, or Azure DevOps.                 Own the backlog for your products and are Comfortable with agile ceremonies.                   ?       Define user problems and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders on solutions.                 Communicate development requirements in epic and user story formats, clearly articulating Acceptance criteria.                 Good to have an understanding of healthcare products or Data solutions.                 Facilitate grooming and planning sessions and retrospectives with the product development team.                 Track metrics to measure product health, adoption, and success.                 Participate in all new implementation projects as a key stakeholder.                 Maintain basic knowledge of the customer data platform, and a basic understanding of cloud-based applications, SAAS, B2B, B2C, and cloud providers like Azure.                 Lead global privacy compliance requirements to competently represent these concepts to product developers.                 Able to contribute to design from the functional aspect and comfortable working with UI designers. Knowledge of or experience building APIs.                 Assist team members with special projects as assigned.                 Education:         BE/BTech in     Computer Science Engineering from top-tier school (IITs, RECs, etc.).

column2: Defining and prioritizing the product backlog: This involves working with stakeholders to determine what features and functionality should be included in the product, and determining the priority in which they should be delivered.     Acting as the voice of the customer: The Product Owner is responsible for representing the needs and interests of the end-users in the product development process.     Making decisions: The Product Owner has the final say on what is included in each release, and makes decisions on trade-offs between scope, schedule, and budget.     Collaborating with the development team: The Product Owner works closely with the development team to clarify requirements, provide feedback on work in progress, and ensure that the product is delivered on time and within budget.     Continuously monitoring and adjusting the product roadmap: The Product Owner is responsible for ensuring that the product remains aligned with the company's overall strategy, and for adapting the product roadmap as necessary in response to changing market conditions and customer needs.
column11: Trade, Budgeting, Monitoring

column2: We are seeking great product managers to join our team. This role will be responsible for conceptualizing, defining, launching, and managing 314e s healthcare product offerings for its enterprise customers.     As a product manager, you will help define and build new products and features that make it easier for medical professionals to adopt technology in their day-to-day lives. Product managers at 314e collaborate closely with internal engineering as well as customer-focused teams and existing/potential customers to set strategies for, define, design, and directly manage all aspects of the customer experience.     A successful candidate will be customer-obsessed, highly analytical, have experience working on B2B enterprise products, and be adept at building high-quality products with a focus towards shipping meaningful software. The ideal candidate will be able to focus, both on the big picture for the future as well as the immediate priorities of the here-and-now. The candidate should be able to work iteratively experimentally, building support for their vision, while taking input from other contributors.   Basic Qualifications      5+ years of experience in software product management         Bachelor s degree in an engineering discipline         Ability to contribute to product strategy and roadmap         Prior startup experience         Ability to meaningfully contribute to engineering discussions around technology decisions         Experience leading cross-functional teams         Enjoys living in a complex, ambiguous, and fast-paced environment using agile process and experimentation     Preferred Qualifications      Lived the product life. You ve shipped products that have made a positive impact on business customer metrics. You have demonstrated the ability to build consensus, and securing buy-in amongst conflicting priorities of different team members. You have proven ability to make smart decisions when encountered with features versus time-to-market trade-offs.         Analytical and data-focused. You have demonstrated the use of data and metrics to support your assumptions and assertions of business parameters. You benefit from your strong analytical skills and ability to dive deep into the subject matter and develop a comprehensive understanding of your customers and their needs to create effective solutions. You have experience in gathering data (primary or secondary) and in making high impact decisions even in the absence of a lot of facts and figures to support your decisions.         Strong technical understanding. You can understand, discuss, and challenge software design concepts, develop trade-offs, and identify potential business opportunities with technical team members.         Excellent communication skills. You are equally comfortable taking the center stage and getting your message across to a board-room full of CXOs, negotiating timelines in an all-hands tech-team meeting, or writing a detailed six-page narrative on your products that you can defend with the customer s business, technology finance teams. You can condense six pages to one page without losing the meaning, and vice-versa.         Strong collaboration skills. You have demonstrated the ability to work across seniority levels, functions, and roles, to influence senior leadership. You quickly earn the trust of the people you work with. People enjoy and have fun working with you.         Empathy. You can put yourself in the shoes of the customers and can translate their real needs into crisp, actionable, detailed product requirements. You can develop innovative product solutions that are grounded in a deep understanding of customer needs.         Bias for action. Your default setting is to take action, and not wait for things to happen. You love to learn about new ideas and ways to improve the customer experience. You obsess about what matters most to customers and can align product offerings to deliver benefits to customers quickly.
column11: Analytical skills, Trade, Software design, PDF, Agile, Manager Technology, Healthcare, Software product management, Customer experience, Product strategy

column2: We are looking for an experienced and results-driven Product Manager to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of proven experience in product management, with a passion for delivering innovative and market-leading solutions. As a Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in defining the product strategy, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and driving the successful development and launch of new products.        Responsibilities         Product Strategy: Develop and articulate a comprehensive product strategy aligned with business goals and market trends.      Product Lifecycle Management: Oversee the entire product lifecycle from ideation to launch, ensuring timely delivery and market success.      Market Research: Conduct market research, analyze customer needs, and identify opportunities for product enhancements and new feature development.      Requirements Definition: Collaborate with stakeholders to define clear and concise product requirements, including features, functionality, and user experience.      Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams to ensure seamless communication and collaboration throughout the product development process.      Prioritization: Prioritize features and enhancements based on market needs, business objectives, and resource constraints.      Roadmap Development: Create and maintain a product roadmap, outlining the product vision and release timelines.      User Feedback: Gather and analyze user feedback, incorporating insights to iterate and improve product features.      Competitor Analysis: Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies to inform product strategy.      Metrics and KPIs: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and impact of product initiatives.          Qualifications:         Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or a related field. MBA is a plus.      Minimum of 5+ years of product management experience, preferably in a technology-driven environment.      Proven track record of successfully launching and managing products throughout their lifecycle.      Strong analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skills.      Excellent communication and collaboration skills.      Experience working with Agile methodologies.      Familiarity with product management tools and software.
column11: IT services, Product management, Analytical, Product life cycle management, Agile, Market research, Engineering Design, Product marketing, Product strategy

column2: Role & responsibilities    Seeking a passionate product management specialist to join our team and help achieve the next leap in our organization's journey. In this pivotal role, you will lead the development and continuous improvement of our product lines, set strategic direction, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and act as the bridge between business, technology, and user experience  Preferred candidate profile     Define a compelling product vision and strategy, ensuring alignment with the company's goals and vision. Own the development, launch, and continuous improvement of product lines  end to end management of the product lifecycle from concept to launch and future iterations. Work closely with engineering, design, and business teams to bring products to life - act as a bridge between these teams, facilitating communication and collaboration. Conduct in-depth market research around competitors products and stay on top of trends to inform product development and strategy. Gather product feedback and create/maintain a single repository of ideas to improve the product experience for the end user and clients.  Establish regular communication with the CTO, CEO, and business heads to prioritize and sequence the execution of initiatives. Translate business objectives into product specifications and story points; determine the baseline KPIs / metrics to measure the productivity of the technology development team. Employ agile methodologies and best practices to accelerate the product development lifecycle; foster a culture of continuous productivity improvement and innovation. Ensure that the products can scale rapidly, handle high volumes of traffic, and can deliver a seamless user experience even during peak demand periods. Bring in industry best practices, be a thought partner to the senior management team in thinking strategically about agile product development. Perks and benefits
column11: Product Strategy, Roadmap, Digital Product

column2: Role & responsibilities   Collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and internal teams to gather, prioritize, and document product requirements, ensuring they align with user needs and industry trends. Clearly define and document product features, including use cases, user stories, and functional specifications for development teams. Maintain a product roadmap, outlining feature development timelines and release schedules. Determine feature priorities based on business objectives, customer feedback, market research, and competitive analysis. Develop product revenue forecasts, measure, and monitor sales performance against them. Support the creation, management of, and participation in, leading customer groups, including advisory boards, experts, domain groups, etc. Write and contribute to various collateral, including sales, website, social media, and white papers. Validate product user requirements are being met as the software iterations are built. Oversee and contribute to industry-specific and solution-specific product components. Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies and industry trends to inform product innovation. Collaborate with development teams to ensure the timely and accurate delivery. Champion an exceptional user experience by considering usability, user interface design, and user feedback in the product development lifecycle. Contribute to the creation and delivery of new product training for internal teams prior to public product launches. Create and maintain product documentation to support internal teams. Contribute to the annual customer training and education conference, in addition to ad hoc customer events as needed. Preferred candidate profile   Must have at least a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. 4+ years of experience in managing laboratories, or helping laboratories improve their processes, or using Lean methodology to improve processes. Previous experience as a product manager, business analyst, or in a related role, preferably in the laboratory informatics or LIMS domain. In-depth knowledge of LabVantage LIMS or similar laboratory informatics software. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders, provide leadership, develop, and manage project plans, prioritize activities. A customer-focused approach and a strong advocate for user needs and product excellence. PMC III or above certification with Pragmatic Institute (or similar) preferred. Team player  focused on collaborative working. Interest in working with/across a global team.

column2: Job Title: ?Enterprise B2B Product Manager Location: ?Malad West (Mumbai) Role: ?Onsite Overview: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Enterprise B2B Product Manager to lead the product roadmap and manage existing relationships with our clients. As the Product Manager, you will be responsible for defining product strategies, driving expansion of product features and utility by generating new needs for our enterprise clients. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand market needs, drive product strategy, and ensure successful product delivery. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, exceptional leadership skills, and a passion for building cutting-edge B2B products that drive business growth and customer satisfaction. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute product strategies to drive growth and market leadership in the enterprise B2B segment. Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape. Define product roadmaps, prioritize feature enhancements, and manage product backlog based on customer requirements and business objectives. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, sales, and customer success, to align product initiatives with company goals and objectives. Lead product discovery workshops and engage with customers to gather feedback, validate product concepts, and iterate on product designs. Work closely with engineering teams to define product requirements, review technical specifications, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality product releases. Lead product launch activities, including creating product documentation, developing go-to-market strategies, and supporting sales enablement efforts. Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, customer feedback, and market trends to identify opportunities for product improvement and optimization. Serve as the subject matter expert for enterprise B2B products, providing guidance and support to internal teams and external clients. Stay up-to-date on industry best practices, emerging technologies, and market trends in enterprise software and B2B solutions Will be responsible for increasing a certain percentage of revenue from key accounts through Value Added Services Qualifications: Must have: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred. Overall ?7+ years of experience in product management, with a focus on enterprise B2B products for minimum 2 years Proven track record of successfully launching and managing complex software products for enterprise clients. Strong understanding of the enterprise software market, including cloud computing, and digital transformation trends. Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to translate customer needs and market insights into actionable product plans and strategies. Bonus: Strong analytical skills and data-driven decision-making mindset. Interest in UI/UX purely from a learning perspective, a major plus

column2: Job Title Product Manager / Product Owner Location Gurgaon (on-Site) Exp Required  3+ years  FreightMango is a hypergrowth logistics technology start-up that is addressing the over 1 trillion-dollar international  freight shipping market. We  currently have locations in the United States and India. We are backed by Man Capital, 1984 Ventures, and Vanguard  Logistics. We have a strong bias for action. Above all, our PMs are driven by impact, not features. We drive ??roblem discovery??& delivery - not only obsess over ??hat to build?? but execute with rigor to create impact. You will influence senior stakeholders across teams such as Engineering, Design, Marketing, Operations, and Finance to bring a new product to life. What Will You Do Understand the Freight logistics market and needs of users deeply through qualitative/quantitative techniques Facilitate a process to come up with the best technology-led ideas to solve the prioritised problems Experiment with multiple ideas and test them using MVPs, prototypes, etc. Participate in strategic planning activities and develop an AI roadmap aligned to the company's needs and vision. Identify new business opportunities and priorities pursuits for AI. Establish processes, operations, measurement, and controls for end-to-end AI life cycle management. Align, mentor, and manage AI teams around strategic initiatives. Build and maintain a culture of innovation and continuous learning within the AI/ML team. Expertise in two or more areas: chatbots, conversational interfaces, NLP, machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI), data analytics, Generative AI Proficiency of standard tools (Asana, Fullstory, Clarity, GA etc) Hands-on with SQL and Python/ R Interested candidates can share their resume on careers@freightmango.com

As one of the top 3D rendering companies in the USA, we are committed to delivering high-quality visualizations that bring projects to life. Role Overview: The Product Delivery Manager at Biorev LLC will be responsible for shaping the future of our products. This role requires a deep understanding of both the business and technical aspects of product development. The ideal candidate will create comprehensive business and technical requirement documents, outline development phases, and ensure the product aligns with the company's long-term goals. Key Responsibilities:  Collaborate with the technical lead and company owner to define the product vision and mission.  Develop and maintain business requirement documents (BRDs) and technical requirement documents (TRDs).  Plan and oversee the development of the product's minimum viable product (MVP) and subsequent phases.  Identify potential revenue streams and explore integration opportunities with third-party products and APIs.  Continuously assess and incorporate feedback to refine product strategy and development plans. Skills and Qualifications:  Proven experience in product management or delivery, preferably in a startup environment.  Strong technical background with an understanding of software development processes and methodologies.  Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with both technical and non-technical team members.  Strategic thinker with the ability to create detailed plans for product development and market introduction.  Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and experience in managing cross-functional teams. Expectations:  The Product Delivery Manager should be a visionary, capable of understanding the broader picture while paying attention to the minutiae of product development.  They should be proactive in identifying potential challenges and agile in devising and implementing solutions.  A commitment to continuous learning and improvement, staying abreast of industry trends and technological advancements. This role is not just about managing timelines and deliverables; it's about being a part of something transformative. The Product Delivery Manager will play a critical role in bringing our innovative products to market, impacting the industry, and contributing to our company's success

column2: About the role--             Primarily focused on:             Drive the execution of all product lifecycle processes for our Data Science and Analytics products, including product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product launch.             Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and/or visual mockups for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams.             Communicating verbally and in writing to customers/prospects with various levels of technical knowledge, pitching Firstlight s data science capabilities, educating them about our data systems, as well as sharing insights and recommendations.             Create product strategy documents that describe business cases, high-level use cases, technical requirements, revenue, and ROI             Being the champion for a data-first culture at Firstlight and ensuring requirements related to data governance and security are developed and prioritized.             Analyze market data to assist in the development of sales strategies, and effective marketing communication.             Contributing to creation of product collaterals including pitch decks, product demos API documentation, and more.             Driving product capabilities to evaluate data from live products, including how to design and execute various A/B and multivariate tests to shape the next iteration of a product.             Evaluate the output captured in statistical analyses and translate them into insights to inform product decisions.                   Firstlight Media staff reports into offices in a hybrid capacity (i.e partially at home, and partially at the office based on role/team needs) leveraging safety protocols aligned with local public health guidelines as they relate to COVID-19             About you--              5-8 years of progressive experience in a similar role.             Mid to senior-level product management professional with background driving software      products related to data visualization, data analytics, or data science/machine learning.             Experience interacting directly with customers and partners on technical / product related topics.             Must have a thorough understanding of the agile software development life cycle (SDLC) processes and tools.              Excellent written, verbal, presentation communication skills.             Experience with cloud-based data warehousing technologies such as BigQuery/Snowflake and/or data visualization tools such as Tableau/Looker and/or SQL/NoSQL databases.             Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.             Self-starter, ability to work with some ambiguity and comfort working with cross-functional teams.             Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously while prioritizing time and resources based on business impact.             Quick learner and ability to understand technology opportunities and challenges at a business level.             Preferred Bachelor of Business/Business Analytics/Information Systems / Engineering / Math / Science degree or equivalent experience.

column2: OVERVIEW:       The Tableau CRM (Einstein Analytics) Manager is responsible for the administration of the company s Einstein analytics/Tableau CRM platform; this includes system configuration (maintenance, system enhancements/upgrades to dashboards and dataflows, etc.), creation of reports and dashboards, end-user training and data integrations, data hygiene and integrity.      This role collaborates with functional leaders to identify, define, and implement changes and enhancements to meet business requirements in a dynamic, high-growth environment. In addition, this candidate will have a strong SFDC Admin background to be a support system for the database (Salesforce).     The ideal candidate will have exceptional technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills and be comfortable interacting with all levels of the organization.      We are seeking a self-starter, with a bias towards action, who can recognize and make process improvement recommendations.      You will identify new and creative opportunities to leverage Einstein and its database (Salesforce) to support additional business processes, functions, and data visualizations.      You will also be a motivated, team oriented and passionate individual towards the Salesforce technology.      This person should have a deep understanding of not only Einstein but also be very data oriented.      An ideal candidate will continually keep learning and keep their skills sharp.        OPPORTUNITY HIGHLIGHTS:       Responsible for configuration, design, functionality, and end-user support of the Einstein and Salesforce platform.         Create datasets, dataflows, recipes, and scheduled jobs.         Can read and write SAQL queries.         Engage with business stakeholders to gather & analyze requirements and propose solutions that leverage Einstein and Salesforce functionality.         Translate approved solutions into actionable deliverables, ensuring high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency.         Builds out of the box dashboards and visualization of data to support both managerial and leadership level requests.         Assess and Troubleshoot bugs and data discrepancies within the analytics platform.         Support our SFDC platform from an operations administration standpoint.         Maintain user roles and profiles, security settings, access settings, etc. (User Profiles, Role Hierarchy, Sharing Rules and Security).         Establish and implement change control and best practices with regards to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.         Manage data imports, database de-duping and cleanup.         Utilize workbench, dataloader, import wizard, DemandTools and other data management assets.         Manage the integration of applications connected to Salesforce.com, including but not limited to Salesforce CPQ, ZoomInfo, Marketo,, Xactly, etc.         Identify production risks and areas for improvement; prioritizes, designs, and facilitates successful implementation and adoption of new processes.         Support the Business Applications team in cross-functional projects and strategic changes to systems and processes.         Collaborate with Business Applications, Sales and Marketing, Information Technology and other business stakeholders to drive high levels of data integrity and operational reliability of our standardized business analytics, tools and processes.         Develop and implement training for end-users. Create and maintain all training materials and guides for processes related to Salesforce.com business applications.       DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:           Certified Salesforce Administrator is mandatory Up to Date certification         Certified Salesforce Advanced Administrator (Preferred)         Einstein Analytics Experience is mandatory (Certification preferred)         Tableau experience (preferred)         5+ years of experience configuring on the Salesforce.com platform.         3+ years of experience configuring Salesforce Analytics and driving data solutions.         Demonstrated experience in creating complex datasets and dataflows.         Demonstrated experience with manipulating and merging data from different custom and standard objects.         Ability to identify areas for process improvement and recommend/implement solutions.          Proven creativity and problem-solving skills; ability to work around obstacles and solve problems with minimal direction.          Strong understanding of data structures and data modeling.         Ability to develop effective relationships with business users, technical staff, and executive management.          Strong organizational/time management skills; ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.         Excellent written and oral communication skills.         Strong work ethic, hands-on, with a customer service mentality.         Flexible with a demonstrated ability to embrace change.          Experience with SF1 mobile configuration, Apex programming, Visualforce pages, and Data Loader preferred.         Experience working in an Agile Framework (Scrum or Kanban) preferred.
